headline: I found the learning content for the‚Ä¶
reviewBody: I found the learning content for the maths functional skills out dated and juvenile in its format. Along with multiple errors like typos and grammar. When I started to do mock exams I realised that the online learning was not representative of what was expected in the exam. Eg. the exam questions were far more complex than what I was used to studying with the online content. I also noted that certain subjects were not covered online but we‚Äôre asked in the exam. I found the staff I dealt with helpful and competent  but they were so understaffed that I was unable to get the tuition I needed before the exam. As with many people I‚Äôve struggled with maths all my life and failed all maths exams at school often getting ungraded marks. For that reason I invested endless hours of study and gained 70% pass in my mock exam. Unfortunately however I failed my real exam. It would be easy for me to loose confidence and believe I didn‚Äôt try hard enough, or I‚Äôm not clever enough to pass. Had I been given material that accurately reflected the final exam to learn from I think I would have passed easily. Learn direct charge a considerable amount of money for their courses and exam bundles, but I can‚Äôt help but feel I was set up to fail.

headline: ‚ö†Ô∏è Be aware of Learn Direct ‚ö†Ô∏è
reviewBody:
Waiting for our fraudulently taken ¬£1213.59 to be refunded to my fianc√©es bank account. The agreed course deposit payment amount was only meant to be ¬£9.99!!!!! 

We have specific email proof from the poor employee that dealt with the initial situation. 

Shocking company, principals and lack of care for anyone! It‚Äôs be well over 6 weeks and still nothing or contact!!! Especially during these testing times for people losing jobs, furloughed, unclear on futures. Truly shocking Learn direct!!! 

If you‚Äôre reading this, be well aware of Learn Direct. Do some home work and read other reviews before giving them any money. You may never see it again!!

Learn direct please feel free to get in touch to resolve the issue before we take it much further! 

#shocking #theft #learndirect #sameoldtricks #con #beaware #daylightrobbery

headline: OUTSTANDING SUPPORT

headline: Avoid avoid avoid
reviewBody:
The company drives me insane. I applied to sit an exam only with them back in May, after informing them I was on a tight deadline as I needed results back by 31st August for work in the NHS and university. 
They made a mistake and registered for me on the wrong course after taking my money and said that I would need to pay more to rectify it and sit the exams I paid to sit at the start! I then get the go ahead to sit the exams and there's apparently a long waiting list. Roll forward to AUGUST I have sat the exams most recent one 2 weeks ago, and I am still waiting for results for it, apparently I MIGHT get their internal results which are preliminary tomorrow, however I've no idea when I am going to get the results from the exam board as they haven't even recieved it yet. Its safe to say that I will be missing out on university this year because of this company, due to the last working day of August being tomorrow as its a Bank Holiday weekend. Absolute joke. I've wasted ¬£700! And could have sat it for free going on an evening course for a year, but didn't since they promised me I could sit my exams the week after I signed up with them!! 
No doubt ill get a fail now ife posted this review.

headline: Highly recommend
reviewBody: I chose learn direct based on reviews, their website and their competitive prices. It‚Äôs easy to get started and straight forward to use, nothing complicated and no unnecessary jargon. The course is broken up into steps and easy to fit around my work/home life. They have been great with support and customer services are friendly and polite, I‚Äôm never on hold for long. I will remain with learn direct for the foreseeable.

headline: Emailed details straight away
reviewBody: Emailed details straight away, correspondence with examination officer was brilliant speedy reply‚Äôs and replying to all of my queries and questions. Exam was very professional,  invigilator Was professional and competent. Howver I called for extra and asked to add on learning to my exam 4+ times getting a vm every time. Voicemails left asking if I could add on learning to my exam for extra costs I was willing to pay for no reply. The many times I called I received no answer left polite voicemails with contact details still no answer. I found a tutor of my own and managed to pass my exam howver considering the exam was booked when covid 19 occurred I‚Äôm lucky to have found someone the online teaching would have been very helpful and in theory the company has lost out on money as I was willing to pay the money for the teaching. I can‚Äôt fault the examinations office- JS was fantastic and the invigilator the exam ran smoothly and results came in a prompt  timing howver the lack of response from the other teams (Possibly sales team) was disappointing

headline: Very unhelpful and uncaring tutors
reviewBody: The content regarding the course I am doing and the study materials are very good. Still, the tutor who is there to assist you with any enquiries (and actually I wouldn‚Äôt class as a tutor is more of a course marker because the course material that‚Äôs written is the one that teaches you)  actually finds any question you ask for further clarity (or further understanding because you are left to your own devices to study) a chore to answer and just refers you back to re-read the material. I‚Äôm quite glad there is a student forum because the student submits their experience and provide much more tremendous help than the tutor does. I would say if you are experienced in studying it‚Äôs not a bad place to learn but be prepared the tutor has very little care in your progression and has very little care to provide you with any support. I can‚Äôt fault the admin team who enrol you who ironically from my experience couldn‚Äôt do any more to make sure you are doing the right course and have the best competitive price. At the end of each module, you ask to review how confident you are with your submission, but I have no idea what happens with that graded feedback. There doesn‚Äôt seem to be an option to say what your experience is like and highlight that actually it would be grateful to have a tutor who does put some care into their students.

headline: STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY
reviewBody:
STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY. 

I initially signed up and was excited however unfortunately my financial situation changed and I needed to cancel and withdraw. However I was then informed that I could withdraw however they are still charging me each month. 

I have written 3 emails to complain and sort this out however they do not reply. When I try to ring they do not answer!!

Was also called two weeks later to make an additional payment before I could receive my refund and when I spoke to the complaints department was told there was no note of my cancellations. headline: I would urge everybody thinking of‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
I would urge everybody thinking of enrolling to stay far far away from this  company.

I cancelled within the 14 day period and I'm now being threatened with high court enforcement and BAILIFFS!

I've emailed MANY times with my concerns etc and I'm either ignored, or not taken seriously. I have a LONG string of emails back and forth bickering with absolutely NO help or understanding apart from 'you have to pay'. I have serious concerns about the course I signed up to, and the SUB STANDARD teaching, but I haven't been taken seriously at all.

I received independant advice that I was within my rights with everything I have done but when I quoted MY LEGAL RIGHTS as a consumer, which protect me, I was told by Learn Direct 'those are a sweeping statement." -Yeah, course, the LAW that's put in place to protect me from vultures like YOU!

I've never been so disgusted at the customer service and treatment of a customer in all my life. They can't even follow their own complaints procedure either. I asked again and again over 2 months ago to make a complaint and my complaint was never even submitted.

Sure, it's easy to sign up. But be VERY, VERY careful. I would advise to go elsewhere where you can get better for A LOT cheaper. I have serious concerns about Learn Direct, and I plan to take this further. We'll see how far your bailiffs get.

(+Not surprised at all Learndirect were branded INADEQUATE by OFSTED)

headline: If i could give 0 stars i would
reviewBody:
EDIT, so giving a lovely edit and update, so i have emailed learn direct as requested in their general response and low and behold. I am still waiting a response from them. I have received my nail kit after months and months however, i am still waiting my ¬£100 cash back which i was informed would take 30 days we are now nearly 3 months later. I am currently speaking with my bank to see if i can recall my money due to the false advertisement of learn direct. I am also speaking with trading standards and OFSTED. DO NOT BUY ANY COURSES FROM THIS COMPANY!!!!!!



If i could give 0 stars i would. Signed up for level 3 nail tech course, ¬£19.99 to start with and ¬£48.70 for 10 months. The course highlights once you get a free nail kit with the course after paying at least 50% for the course which is fine by me. Course also says once paid for you get ¬£100 cash back. So i was half way through paying February time and waited on my nail kit. We then entered lock down and everything went all up in the air so i forgot about the nail kit. Come June i start asking about my nail kit to be told its on its way don't worry its being packed you will get an email to say it will come. Two weeks later no nail kit, to be told yes we don't have it still waiting, but you told me 2 weeks ago it was there and on way. To be told yes well this was not true. I have then spent the last 3 months trying to get a nail kit that i have paid for that they do not seem to want to give me, i have paid for the course now and guess what yup i am now fighting to get my ¬£100 cash back from learndirect wonder if this will be blamed on the pandemic as well? Learndirect are now refusing to answer my emails when i have rang to ask what is happening i have just spoken to the most rude and condescending person ever who informed me they had a meeting this morning and still not nail kit but does not know anything as its not her job. So how did she know about the nail kit? I am sick to death of being fobbed off. I would NEVER use them again and will be telling everyone i know to NEVER use them either. Horrible Horrible horrible company.

headline: Out dated expensive rip off waste of time
reviewBody:
Update 10.9.2020- despite them leaving the email below I have contacted multiple people and still not received feedback or my cheque 
AVOID the clowns 

Update: I have been waiting since December for my course to be updated as complete, haven‚Äôt heard anything from the tutor since December and have had no feedback for course completion. Still no cheque received for cash back after a month of waiting.


Update - still waiting on a cheque. 
Not convinced there are actually tutors. 
Spoke to a lady on customer service who was going to escalate my concern. Haven‚Äôt heard from her 
Has everyone left?


Out dated expensive rip off. I paid for a course in SEN, which I doubt it‚Äôs credibility for one. The course appears to be out dated and the questions for the wording seem to be very basic comprehension style. Never any difference in feed back from the tutor. Just the same sentence re written each time. Which offered me no chance of development or insight into what I learnt. Finished the course in one month due to its simplicity. I contacted them for my 100pound cash back to be told it would be sent as a cheque. Who deals in cheques anymore?!? Two weeks and am still waiting, I presume I will be waiting even longer for any type of certificate. Personally I wouldn‚Äôt waste my time again on learn direct. Go to a college or further education setting and discuss with education professionals if you are looking to develop your skills

headline: Cheap, outdated and rubbish
reviewBody:
I opted for a massage course though Learndirect to keep me busy through lockdown.  Luckily it was just 'something to do'.  The course included written theory only, with poor diagrams and nothing in the way of videos or examples (essential I would say on a massage course)!  The course must have least written ten years ago as it suggests to advertise your massage business through the newspapers or yellow pages!!  The assessment required nothing more than cut and paste and there was no need to show any real learning or thinking.

Got what I paid for.

Cheap rubbish.

headline: I am really enjoying my horticulture‚Ä¶

headline: Highly disappointed avoid at all cost
reviewBody:
Update: having called customer service, multiple times, finally got through, after being told i would receive a refund as of the 7th of August now it's from the 19th and will take 30 days from then. Totally disgusting for a company to sell outdated courses that aren't worth the money. Research accredited before being sucked in as it's not valid most places. No wonder ofsted rated them inadequate in 2017 and the government removed all their contracts. 

Initially signed up and everything seemed great. Questions answered, sales great, however, the course content was not as expected. Luckily I cancelled in the 14 days but just in case don't submit anything if you are unsure as others have been refused refund for this reason. Course content looked like it had not been changed since it was written 15 years ago and even stated awaiting update 2007 on specific guidelines. Very unprofessional for the price course and also on response from learndirect that most learners are not bothered by it and will usually continue the course. Sadly it put me off enough to cancel. So the cancellation process within 14 days. Call to cancel after 7, informed I had to complete an online form, which I did, then informed it would take up to 7 days to receive a telephone interview call for the cancellation to proceed, after the telephone call I was informed my cancellation would go ahead. After a week I called as no sign of refund. Was told it takes 30 days to process. A week after this I received an email confirming my cancellation, yes just over 2 weeks after my cancellation request telephone conversation, where I had been told I had cancelled and would get refunded. 

Added to that the incentive after the first few days receiving the course access to write a positive trust pilot review and be in with a chance of winning a free course. Sorry to say, I've since done my own research. The courses may say accredited but they don't mean a lot and are not worth the money. Look at the invited reviews, they are the ones where people starting are bribed to write reviews with the chance to win free courses. Seriously disappointed and definitely not a recommendation from me.

headline: It was stressful!
reviewBody:
In September last year, I signed to a course and the man I spoke to seemed lovely and seemed to know what he was talking about. I read the reviews and people were struggling to get answers about certain things and even struggling to get the certificates from them. The guy explained this away as they probably hadn‚Äôt paid their fees yet and that was the reason for their delay. I signed up after having a few concerns cleared up. 
Forward it on to the completion of my course in March this year. Buzzing that I had finished and I‚Äôd got my email to say it had been graded. With excitement I checked to see where you normally get a pass or fail and it just received. I emailed learn direct to be told that I should get an email to say I‚Äôve passed. This didn‚Äôt happen. I was told various different this over months of trying to find out what was happening. I was then told it would take 12-14 weeks to find out if I‚Äôd passed. At 18 weeks I still hadn‚Äôt heard anything. It was so frustrating and annoying not knowing. Learn direct didn‚Äôt really have a clue and I kept getting different information every time I spoke to them, they aren‚Äôt really interested unless signing up to do a course or you‚Äôre settling up you balance. Even when I had paid up there was no further information given about my course or the status. I received my certificate (5 months after paying it off) in the post today which is great and I suppose you can say they did their job to a certain extent. Just be mindful that if you do a course through this company, don‚Äôt expect them to know what‚Äôs happening with your course. I know they‚Äôll blame Covid but they literally had no clue about how the course worked or was marked regardless. 
That being said the course was good but slightly outdated but I definitely learnt a lot from it and it encouraged me to look in to policies for myself. I would do more now I know what to expect.

headline: New Beginnings
reviewBody: I am so excited to start my new chapter in life. I had ventured back and forth over Learn Direct and attending a college course. Due to my current employer, I could not attend set days at college, therefore online learning is the way forward for me. I researched and compared the courses to find the Access to Higher Education course through Learn Direct is exactly the same that I would have earned attending college. I now have the bonus of immediate access to my online course without having to leave the house.... I'm staying firmly put when its raining or snowing outside. This alone makes me extremely happy! I questioned online Learn Direct advisors for weeks, they all responded quickly and had a answer for every question I threw at them. I researched the future university I wish to attend and they confirmed they definitely accept Learn Direct qualifications so that put my mind at ease. I then spoke to a Learn Direct advisor, the advice given is so clear I was left with no doubts. I knew exactly who I was speaking to, who will call me later in the week just to check on me and who I can contact throughout my course. They have a big support network so you can't and won't be stuck on your own at any point. I had concerns I wouldn't be able to achieve enough UCAS points, I was advised by James I would need a merit to score enough UCAS points but I shouldn't be disheartened as I could easily aim for Distinction if i put my mind to it. I can complete the course in my own time, up to 2 years. I aim to smash this course with flying colours within 1 year or less. Even more satisfied James told me they help with University applications and they have a immense network of school, college and university connections. I'm so happy I can pay for this course over 10 months, I couldn't afford full payment in one go (tough when saving for a wedding!) As promised, I would get three confirmation emails. I set up my login and BAM.... there's my course ready to start immediately. I have taken on this new direction due to Covid, I currently work in the travel industry and Im really not sure how that will pan out but I feel confident I'm moving in the right direction into Nursing. I really couldn't have made this change without the online learning from Learn Direct. Im currently 35, my advice to anyone ..... It really is never too late to change direction. Today is my first day as a online student, I finally understand the direction I want to go in. I will achieve my dream to be a registered nurse thanks to taking my first steps with Learn Direct.

headline: Cancellation outside of 14 day period? No chance....
reviewBody:
The content of the course was great and when I was signing up to the course the customer service was great too (but obviously they were getting my money so they would be). However, due to the current pandemic, I have suffered a couple of bereavements and loss of income so I'm not able to cover the costs anymore. I haven't completed any modules and have only just started reading the first module. I called up the customer service team and the operative on the end of the phone was extremely unhelpful and un-empathetic. The tone of her voice was unpleasant and told me that because it was out of the 14 day cooling off period there was nothing they could do. I then drew her attention to where the agreement states outside of the 14 day period, cancellations may be considered on a case by case basis with a 50% cancellation fee if accepted. I was happy to go down this route but then she said the manager wasn't back in until Tuesday next week and an answer wouldn't be sought until then at least. I was still happy to do this. She then said it's very unlikely they will accept this. This, in my opinion, is evidence they will not consider me on a case to case basis. It's really not difficult to show a little bit of compassion even if there really is nothing you can do. 

I won't be using this online platform again.

headline: Course OK but so much spam email/calls.
reviewBody:
Even after my last review AND writing to them to request my details be removed from all mailing lists, I‚Äôve just received ANOTHER email asking me to leave a TrustPilot review. 

So again I‚Äôll confirm that the course did what I needed, but in my experience you‚Äôll be spammed with emails and calls once you‚Äôve completed it. Even if you tell them to stop.

Edited to respond to LearnDirects reply:
It seems like you‚Äôre trying to fob me off with the old ‚Äòit‚Äôs automated so it‚Äôs not our fault‚Äô reply. 
It is my understanding that all of these letters will be automated through your customer relationship management system. However you have a legal duty and responsibility to ensure this is set up correctly to prevent customers being spammed. Especially when they have specifically requested you not to contact them.

headline: Misleading T&Cs & breach of contract
reviewBody:
UPADTE: What a surprise! Got a reply to my review saying to contact their customer service team. My case is clearly already being handled so why would I get in touch again to further miscommunicate on their end? Goes to show their complete lack of regard for each individual case.

Another point to add, before you read all of the five star reviews (like I did,) please read the negative reviews. Learndirect encourage people to review right at the start of the course as an incentive to win prizes, that's why there are so many good ones.

--------------------------------------------------------------

Upon signing up to the Access to HE (Social Sciences course) I was reassured by their company representative Harry that I would be eligible for a refund if I didn't get along with the course within 14 days of starting it. I asked him explicitly about their cancellation policy both through the chat function on the website, and on the phone when he called to take payment. This is also stated in their T&Cs.

I began the course, tried out the process of submitting the first unit to see if it would work for me considering I would be doing it for the next year if so. 9 days in, I decided that the course wasn't for me and called their customer service team, as instructed in their cancellation policy, to request a refund and cancel the course.

To put it into perspective, their T&Cs state their cancellation policy as: "In line with The Consumer Rights Act 2015, you also have a 14 day right to change your mind and get a full refund for digital content, i.e. Online courses, that you have purchased, unless you have already started to download it"

I thought: "Well, great! I haven't downloaded anything because it's all through an online portal, I will be eligible for the refund. They haven't stated any reason for me to think otherwise!" If only it could have been that straightforward. 

Let's jump to over a month later, during which: my refund has been refused, I have endured two weeks of horrendous communication with Learndirect/Stonebridge via telephone, email and letters, have called citizens advice for help, am two weeks into disputing the payment with my bank to try and get the money back that way, and am getting ready to take the next steps of going to the ombudsman. The two people who are handling my case are David and Alison. (I wont state surnames as per Trustpilot guidelines.)

Their reason for refusing my refund request? "... Because you have accessed the material, begun the course, and submitted your first piece of work to a tutor, which has been marked." I would be enlightened for someone to tell me where that advice is given in their T&Cs. Is 'unless you download it' supposed to translate into the very detailed reasoning above?

Their misleading cancellation policy is a clear breach of contract, and still Learndirect are not issuing a refund. Considering I paid nearing ¬£1300 for this course, I will be taking all means of trying to get my money back.

Deciding to purchase this course was not something that came lightly. It took months of consideration before I convinced myself to do it as a means of going back to university in the future. Now, as punishment for deciding to try and get back into education, I have lost half of my savings and more than a months pay. This is salt in the wound especially at a time where my income is less than normal and job security isn't certain.

I am writing a letter back to Alison now which I will be sending out tomorrow, and thought I would leave my experience here at the same time.

As they are a local recruiter near to where I live in Bournemouth, I also found it interesting to read the job advertisement and discover that they work on a commission basis. This is definitely reflective of my experience with their customer service team and their lack of empathy. 

If you are signing up to a course with this company and expect your consumer rights to be respected, you might want to think twice before investing.

headline: English and Maths Level 2
reviewBody:
I have enrolled on the combined English and Math Level two course with exams and support included. 

I have only just started this course.  But I can honestly say that It is a pleasant experience already.  The online portal is easy to navigate with clear instructions to follow. Both English and Maths topics are clear and concise Each element has a tutorial followed by Practice exercises to check your understanding, answers to the exercises are available for you to check against your answers At the end of each unit there is a quiz to complete to show your understanding.

If you require assistance at anytime, There is a dedicated  support team who you can call or email at anytime throughout your course.  Contact details are provided when you enrol

If you have purchased support with your course Then a dedicated tutor will be assigned to you.  For the English and Maths course they will mark and return any mock exams.  With this particular course you have the option of taking both exams at home or in one of their centres.


‚ÄòThis course is ideal if you got a poor grade in your GCSE‚Äôs or, like myself, missed out altogether.

Trisha Coles

headline: Sham of a company !
reviewBody:
UPDATE PART TWO - Had a reply on here from Learn Direct who said they will contact me, I‚Äôve had nothing but another email from a David Cox asking silly questions. He is a customer service manager who won‚Äôt talk to customers and takes 2 weeks to reply to emails. He also doesn‚Äôt even read the emails correctly because my first email stated my request clearly and he completely miss read it! 

UPDATE-
I spoke with an advisor today who paused 
my call recording to tell me that this happens all the time and it‚Äôs really annoying because she works in sales, I should go to Ofcom and that David Cox and Zoe won‚Äôt do anything because she always sends complaints through to them. Little do Learn Direct know that I was also recording this call :) 

Sham of a company !! My wife signed up to a course and 4 days later got offered a job that advised they would pay for the course but it has to be done through the council, we tried for ever to call them but kept getting a voice mail for a call back, no call back! Went on the website to request a call back, no call back! Went on the website and acted like we wanted to buy something and guess what? Someone called us as quick as you could say go but couldn‚Äôt help with cancelling the course! Said he sent an email to someone to call but but guess what? No call was received. We sent emails to them to be told we had to ring but when advised we couldn‚Äôt get through was told that this was the only way. In the end on the 13th day we went to the bank and told them what‚Äôs gone on, they blocked them taking money and gave us the deposit back! Now we are having threatening emails saying they will send dept collectors if we don‚Äôt pay, I spoke to someone called Zoe who pretty much just kept saying it‚Äôs after 14 days so she can‚Äôt cancel it, when I told her my story she said that they have been really busy and the phone lines have been busy so this is why we couldn‚Äôt get through. I don‚Äôt see how this is fair and now we have to folk the bill for something we tried to cancel? Mr Cox the manager is extremely rude and unhelpful just demanding we pay and that we have had contact twice according to their systems, their systems are wrong because the only call we had was when she signed up and when I managed to get someone to call me from sales when trying to cancel! AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS! .. OTHER COMPANIES ARE OUT THERE DOING THE SAME COURSES OUT THERE THE SAME PRICE IF NOT A LITTLE MORE EXPENSIVE, I WOULD PAY MORE FOR A BETTER SERVICE.

UPDATE 27/08/2020

headline: I will never use Learndirect again
reviewBody:
I signed up online to the level two English functional skills as I required this to be accepted on to a university course. I had a question reference the course content, as I believe it to be incorrect. I emailed three different learndirect addresses. Only one replied stating that I needed to speak to my personal tutor.
I rang customer services, speaking to Claire and was advised that I should have a personal tutor icon but I didn't. Claire said that she would look into this. Over three weeks had passed and I've heard nothing. 
I've found out today that the course I purchased does not include personal tutor or the exam fee and I can't manage to get an answer to the course content query that I have. 
I have requested a refund as I don't believe the course content is good enough but I have been told that I will not be refunded as I am over the 14 day cooling off period. 
If you are going to sign up to Learndirect do not do this online, speak to an advisor that way you will be told what you are signing up to.

Simon, who helped me enrol, answered all my questions and made sure the university I wanted to go to accepted the diploma, he then talked me through the finances for the course and made sure I was all set up and ready to go.
My tutor for my first module gave really detailed feedback and the student team have followed up with calls to make sure I‚Äôm getting on alright and to make adjustments so that I finish my course in time for university intake in 2021.
Overall it‚Äôs been a fantastic experience and would definitely recommend to anyone wanting to get a qualification that will help them change their career path.

headline: SCAMMERS PLEASE DONT WASTE UR MONEY N TIME!!
reviewBody:
I will release the phone transcript on flowaz gyaden on YouTube by next week sometime. The 14 day Cancellation is a fraud, as the moment u start ur course u cannot cancel under any circumstances. Please be mindful of these scammers. They were very disrespectful asking me if I am done crying yet before hanging up the phone.
I am a single mom on universal credit I can't afford this but they don't care and was not interested in listening.They speak to u in a patronising way and hang up the phone twice because I started to cry and asked for a diploma course transfer instead of certificate of achievement. Both Julie and her colleagues stated that it was my fault for not understanding the cancellation policy. Which clearly stated u have 14 days to cancel which involves 3%admin fee otherwise after 14days it's 50% of course fee for cancellations. It didnt state not to start the course.
I signed up for Health and Social Care level 3 for over ¬£340 on July 30th 2020. I rang learn direct customer representative today August 12th 2020 to cancel the course, after completing 14 modules as I was told it is a level 3 diploma by the manager David who rang to ask if everything was ok on July 31st. He also promised to ring the following Friday to see if all is well. Unfortunately I didn't receive a call or voice message only an email stating if there is any concern I should contact them on a generic email.
This is not a course that will enable you to progress in your jobs or move up the career ladder and it is not recognised in the field of health and social care, as a certificate of achievement is not equivalent to a diploma.
I hope any1 who wishes to progress in their career with a reputable qualification which has value, must enroll with an authentic learning institution. Unfortunately #learndirect.com is a #scamming #fraudulent institution

headline: I don't normally write reviews
reviewBody:
I don't normally write reviews, but I feel this company is horrendous and I would advise to stay clear. 
I would not recommend this company. They take your money then ignore or lie about what they offered you originally, they refuse to cancel or refund courses that are not up to standard.
This is the worse company I have ever dealt with and I will be adding a formal complaint to their list.
I have spent endless hours trying to contact them, either via phone or email. If I ever do manage to get through, I'm told that the manager is dealing with my complaint, therefore customer services can not do anything. I have to add, the manager is rude and unhelpful. I've wrote a formal complaint letter to head office, but have not yet received a response. However, I am receiving threatening emails and phone calls demanding the rest of the money. Appalling.

headline: The course I'm doing for A-Level‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
The course I'm doing for A-Level Mathematics came recommended to me by a tutor from the college I graduated an adult access course from, as they could not cater to my age and needs for part time learning for the subject.

Firstly I would like to say how incredibly helpful the team members are. Everytime I call the student services helpline, I'm greeted with a professional and helpful demeanor and staff have gone above and beyond to assist me.

The course structure is great. I completed a foundation maths GCSE and struggled my entire life with Maths. I can do these modules, in my own time as frequently as I wish until moving on to the next. The content is concise, it gives you exactly what your brain needs to remember and makes revising straightforward. 

The courses will not teach you motivation, initiative or pragmatism. You bring those ingredients yourself, to contribute the sucess in completing the course. One would be expected to go and reasearch a chosen subject, or borrow books from the library to provide alternative understandings as would be expected in a brick and mortar institute; the courses demand no less.

I'd recommend the course for any adult who want the flexibility to study and to upskill through manageable means.

I've wrote to them also. Please please do not use them. It really isn't worth it.

headline: EVEN AFTER CANCELLING YOU STILL HAVE TO BE BATTLING TO GET YOUR MONEY BACK!!
reviewBody: Still haven't received my refund after fighting so hard to get this course cancelled. Its been way over 30 days now since they finally decided to cancel but still no money back. They will reply to reviews saying contact customer service but no one wants to help when you do. They run you down to get started to the course, pressure you and tell you if you change your mind within the 14 days period it's okay to cancel but if you do it is a problem to get it cancelled. This is the worst set of people on the planet. Be very careful, read negative reviews and do your research because most of the bad reviews they get is because of financial issues. This company only want to take your money but are not willing to give it back when you're in all rights to receive it back.....PLEASE CAN YOU THEIVES REFUND MY MONEY THAT YOU PROMISED YOU WOULD!!!!

headline: Please read a few negative reviews‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Please read a few negative reviews first before seeing all the ‚Äúgood‚Äù ones. Like many other people during this difficult time, I am having financial problems and at this point have already paid about ¬£400+ for the course already. I literally can not afford the cost at all right now. I called to ask if in light of this I could cancel the course, I wasn‚Äôt even looking for a refund or anything. I was shocked to hear that there was ‚Äúnothing they could do‚Äù and when it got to the point that debt collectors started contacting me I would see if I can arrange a new payment plan to pay off the debts I‚Äôll incur. I have over ¬£1000 left to pay, and considering I‚Äôm spending a lot of time trying to earn an income and my career path has changed I‚Äôll be paying that for NOTHING. What on earth is wrong with you, this is extremely inhumane, how is this ok?! I won‚Äôt recommend you to anyone.

headline: Honest mixed review
reviewBody:
So the course material is good and easy to navigate but I just struggled with the sales team. I felt pressured into enrolling on their course immediately due to a deal ending in a hour but days later the ‚Äòdeal‚Äô is still there. I then called up pretending to be a new student and they offered me an even cheaper deal than what I‚Äôm getting now and refused to honour it on my current course. 
Do your research first. If you need funding to do this course they are not eligible for that so despite what the website says you will have to self fund it. I also found the feedback on the message system a bit blunt so if you are looking for a personal touch this is not for you. 
Saying all this it‚Äôs the quickest way to get your access to HE diploma if you have a deadline for UCAS but please make sure your chosen university accepts it.

headline: Best decision I have made
reviewBody: I decided to sign up with learn direct to expand my knowledge on domestic abuse to compliment my career path. The sign up process was extremely easy, and the man I spoke to was helpful, friendly and had good knowledge of the course i wanted to do. After sign up I received a call to see how I was getting on and if there was any other questions about the course. I am currently half way through and successfully completed each assignment. It is very encouraging that the tutor leaves positive and constructive feedback to help you develop on the course. I also study with the open University, and as with any online course you need to put the time and effort in without someone being there to prompt you. Overall I am very pleased with the process and I already have 4 more courses I'm looking at doing with learn direct.

headline: Still haven't got my refund...
reviewBody:
UPDATE: In response to the company suggesting I contact Customer Service. I have. Several times.  I still am no further forward. That's why I left a negative review because I'm feeling ignored. And honestly I will not recommend LearnDirect based entirely on this experience.

********


I didn't want to write a negative review but as I am being ignored by the company I feel I have no other course of action. In May I signed up to the Nursing course but decided I wasn't ready for it so cancelled within 14 days. I was told on the phone by Claire in customer service I'd get refunded the ¬£9.99 sign up fee within 30 days. On 2nd June LearnDirect deducted ¬£160.70 from my bank account. I complained and received an email a few days later saying I would again get a refund within 30 days. It is now 5th August and I have not heard from the company despite numerous emails, and still haven't received my refund. 

My advice to anyone is be very, very careful dealing with this company. They seem quick to take your money but very slow to refund. I understand issues with coronavirus and remote working but I was still told 30 days and it's been more than 60. Like everyone I'm short of money so hate losing money for no reason. I had planned on signing back up at a later date but now I wouldn't touch LearnDirect at all.

headline: Livid!
reviewBody:
Enrolled onto a course, but due to the mixed emails and haphazard communications I wasn't even sure I was on it.
Then my life took a serious turn and I became a single parent completely out the blue. 
I contacted learndirect through email and text explaining my dire circumstances and requested a call. Nothing.
I rang but the lines were busy and
so left a message as directed explaining things and requested some - ANY! - form of contact and not to take payment as I could no longer afford the course. 
Nothing.
I contacted the payments dept who in turn put me through to complaints who then basically said "nope, can't help you!". 
I physically CANNOT afford this course and I do not have the time or energy to complete it.
One member of staff I did manage to speak to actually SNIGGERED when she told me I was over the 14 day cancellation period. 
To say I am disgusted and livid is a major understatement. 
I am now down ¬£160 which I really cannot afford. 
Yes I was over the 14 day cancellation period but had I been blessed with the power of foresight I obviously wouldn't have enrolled on the chuffing course in the first place! Hindsight is a wonderful thing. 
Learndirect have been less than helpful.

headline: I think this is an really good company‚Ä¶

headline: Bad experience
reviewBody:
So I enrolled and 15 days later call to explain that I have come across some financial emergencies and won‚Äôt be able to make payments, I was told you cannot cancel the course after 14 days, so I even agreed to pay for the first month even though I didn‚Äôt do anything at all, haven‚Äôt started but now I‚Äôm told whether I continue with the course or not I am still required to pay the whole ¬£1600 for the entire course, the first time I see a no cancellation place.

My advice get your finances in place before enrolling and even though they say enroll now pay later if you enroll mid month at the end of that month the payment is required, that‚Äôs something no one explains when you enroll, I had in mind that the first payment will be required 4 weeks later which is a month but just 2 weeks!!!

headline: Poor Quality. Don't waste Your Money
reviewBody:
I enrolled on the Word Advanced 2016 course with a view to also enrolling on the Excel and Outlook courses. I'm pretty IT competent but with no official qualifications, I basically needed something on my CV to show I had done some recent training and a certificate to show as proof to potential employers.

These courses seemed ideal and the courses description stated that on completion I would 'receive' a certificate. Perfect!

Except that the course is abysmal. All it consists of is a series of short videos one after the other. No interactive tasks, no quizzes, no mini tests and you don't even need to complete the self-assessment to achieve a pass. My total learning time, as logged on their site, was 23 mins!!! 

My time would have been better spent watching a series of YouTube tutorials. However, you can't put YouTube on a CV and it doesn't gain you a certificate. The course was a joke but at least I would 'receive' a certificate, and I could just go off to do my own self-study.

But no! I would only receive a certificate if I paid an additional ¬£25!! What a con. This was not mentioned in the description at all. I paid ¬£31 for the course which was an alleged discount from ¬£51. So they would be making the original price with a few extra quid in their pocket.

You can, however, use your own paper and ink to download a poxy printed out certificate, that frankly, isn't worth the paper it's printed on.

I didn't download it and contacted customer service to ask for a refund. No, was their very blunt answer, due to the fact I'd completed the course. So I paid ¬£31 to print a piece of paper.

In the mid-200s I had a positive experience with Learndirect. I did a fully funded City & Guilds L2 Maths course. That's why I didn't think to check reviews now. I still thought they were a quality learning provider. I notice they are also affiliated with the very dodgy stonebridge college. If I'd have known this, I wouldn't have touched them with a bargepole.

Also, by asking students to leave 5 stars reviews for a chance to be entered into a prize draw is a great way to get 5 star reviews from people who have literally just enrolled and can't assess their full experience. 

Seriously, dont waste your money.

I called two times and after a long while just waiting while listening music I gave up, so I requested a call which is one of the options but no one called me back and I did also try the chat room another two times... In the first chat I have not received any reply even it said ‚ÄúRead‚Äù! The second time I got reply but was taking way too long to just tell me they can help me ... but they didn‚Äôt help at all.
Well I tried so many times in so many different ways but it didn‚Äôt work. I don‚Äôt think this is a very serious and legitimate company and definitely they have no customer service skills. About the courses I have no idea lol I just guess I will never find out!!

headline: I have so far had a wonderful experience
reviewBody: I have so far had a wonderful experience with learn direct, The online adviser I spoke to spent a good hour with me cross checking all the information I had to ensure the course I am on will provide me with the correct units for entry into medical school, He was more than happy to go into extreme detail and provided me with breakdowns of each assignment and their value in order to make sure the course was suited to my needs, He also aided me in discussing finance options and helped me set up everything so I could start learning that day with a small deposit that Didn't require any further payments until 6 weeks later. Every step was incredibly helpful, easy and pleasant. Once enrolled onto my course I was delighted at the amount of extra support learn direct offers including a personal tutor, additional learning material, progress tracking and the option to discuss work with other students, there have also been several follow up messages and phone calls to ensure I'm happy with everything I've received and to offer additional support if required. Learn direct seem to genuinely care about their students and give them every opportunity to reach their potential. I would whole heartedly recommend 5/5

headline: My initial review of the service‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
My initial review of the service provided upon my query phone call to Learn Direct is one of happiness and motivation!
Simon answered all of my queries with regards to multiple courses that  I was interested in and patiently, impartially explained each course to me.  
He listened intently and presented me with suggestions when I was unsure. 
I didn't feel pressured to make a decision or that our conversation was just about the sales.  
I felt that there was genuine care to meet my learners' needs. 
I was then contacted by email to ask if I needed further assistance whereupon I booked the course. 
After which a couple of days later James called to explain the course format and any other queries that I had.  With a follow-up call in a week. 
I feel fully supported by my Tutor through email and the additional benefit of being able to actually call someone for guidance if need be.  
The course content is exactly what I have been looking for. 
I am very happy, thank you, Team :)

headline: ABSOLUTELY AWFUL COMPANY!!
reviewBody:
ABSOLUTELY AWFUL COMPANY!!
I genuinely cannot put into words how angry I am!! I have been looking into doing Maths and English functional skills so I could go on to do Veterinary Nursing...I was sold the 2 courses at ¬£64 a month. I was told these were on offer and down from ¬£1,000 to ¬£600 for 9 months...brilliant or so I thought! 2 months in and I find out these did not include exams and they are and additional ¬£225 each!!! So really they aren't on offer are they because that takes it up to over ¬£1,000. I was led to believe by doing what I was doing I would gain the qualifications I needed...I however was not told of the EXTRA cost!! To be quite honest the course content was definitely not worth ¬£600 and I could have got that out of a book!! 2 poxy hours with a tutor is nothing!! What's worse is they now expect me to pay 50% of the remaining fees to cancel!! Covid at the minute is not helping my financial situation and now this!!! Numerous emails and phone calls since April and im ignored but soon chasing me for money because I havent paid! Not going to happen im afraid!! Absolutely appalling!!

headline: After being told to contact customer‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
After being told to contact customer support for any additional help that can be offered due to the Covid19 pandemic after payment holidays, I received an email apologising but the course will still be passed onto debt collectors if payment isn‚Äôt received. 
The lack of support in this stressful time is disgusting with no option to extend payment holiday even by a month. 
I am receiving no income or benefit at present and still not allowed to go back to work due to Government instruction and will get fined if I do! 
So thanks for the debt collection threat Learn Direct to put on top of that and add to the stress üëç

headline: CANCELLATION!!
reviewBody: If anyone having problems cancelling there course within the 14 days of enrollment contact Trading Standards, it was the best thing I ever did so far!! They have been ignoring me when I've tried contacting them about cancelling I have now gone past my 14th day but as I have proof of attempted cancellation I can use that to help fight my case. I also have screenshotted call logs and recorded a call that went to voicemail (even though they basically called me a liar and said there was no record of my number on there call logs). In line with the Consumer Rights Act 2013 I am entitled to free cancellation and a full refund! So definitely contact Trading Standards as they can help and they also pass on the information to third parties. If you Google Learndirect it also comes up with Ofsted reporting them as inadequate and there is also numerous of articles of fraud. Not looking so well for them!! Don't give up fighting as that's what they want. They will be receiving my letter hopefully in a couple days with printed of documents of our agreement and emails highlighting the important parts. Also to cancel don't ring them like they advise you to do. My agreement said to cancel it has to be in writing (although a lady from Stonebridge said it can't be) Trading Standards made it clear they've made a breach of contract. Send a letter to there address which you will find on there website in the Terms and Conditions section and make sure you send it on recorded delivery and keep a copy and if possible email them too the exact same thing. They can't ignore you then as you are exercising your rights and they will only be digging themselves a bigger hole. I hope that helps all of you who are having trouble with this unprofessional, inadequate, arrogant so-called-company.

headline: Genuinely had a good experience with‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
Genuinely had a good experience with Learn Direct. 

I chose Learn Direct to complete my exam with as they were the only UK provider, that I could find, that offered the option of a remote, home based exam.

My initial contact with my course advisor was informative and helpful. 

Enrolment was quick and easy. I enrolled on Friday and by the following Monday had been fully registered and booked a date to sit my exam. 

I had one issue with logging into my account and contacted my course advisor who quickly arranged for the customer service team to resolve the issue and I was able to log back in straight away.

Online content is good and easy to follow. I have been able to access all information I need and have access to a practice exam which will contribute effectively to my revision and self assessment before completing my exam.

I would certainly recommend Learn Direct to others.

headline: Learndirect people are bandits in disguise
reviewBody:
I have recently showed interest in the assess to nursing for my son and have given my bank details and such but the very same day i have changed my mind and called and told them that i am no longer interested in the course. They sent an email contract to which i did not sign but i paid ¬£9.99 downpayment. 
The person i told i was not interested any more never removed my son name from their roster and so now i have noticed that ¬£160.50 is missing from my bank account and these people in learndirect are telling me that i can not cancell or get a refund.
These people are the devil please members of the public be careful who you give yr bank details to.
We have not logged into their portal or downloaded anything and she wants my hard yearned money for nothing.
Please people be careful with this company
They are bandits in disguise, stealing your money after you said within time that you are no longer interested

headline: Its OK but if you work the support is miniumal due to their opening times and you have to wait days to only get email response
reviewBody: I like the ability to do distance learning and the way they have set out the training its easy to read. However the handbook for my course was 3 years old and was supposed to help you with the learner portal, but it no longer looks or functions like stated in the manual which made it confusing and useless. Plus I work Monday to Friday 9 to 5 which is the only time they are open to speak to a tutor for support. Which means I don't get instant support from a tutor during the evenings or weekend. You have to email and wait till they are open for a reply. For example, if I asked a question about 6pm Friday I won't get a response till sometime Monday, or due to the 24 hour response time, it could end up being Tuesday. The support is too delayed and wastes valuable time, especially when you have deadlines to meet. I feel they should have some tutors that are available for a couple of hours in the evenings and weekends.

headline: Terrible experience and no correspondence
reviewBody:
Unfortunately I couldn‚Äôt give 0 stars! 
I have had nothing but a terrible experience with learn direct. The customer service was absolutely terrible. The study materials is the only positive, as they were easy to follow however I feel SCAMMED! I was never once made aware that my exams were not apart of my monthly payments and the book executive that dealt with my enrolment had me under the impression that they were. When I wanted to do my exams they tried getting ¬£500+ more out of me! I have now been trying to make a complaint and get the mistake on their end rectified for about 2 weeks and I have no had no correspondence through from the customer services manager at all and now I am forced to leave this review in hopes that someone from their team will bother to contact me. Because of this, I was unable to go through with the job I applied for, they‚Äôve put my life on hold. As you can imagine during this pandemic, nobody would want to pay a lot a month for something that is definitely not worth it. Why would I pay monthly for a course and then not be able to take my exams? It‚Äôs absolutely not worth hard earned money especially because of the stress i‚Äôm facing due to this pandemic, and the booking executive had me under the impression that it was all included. I refuse to make any more monthly payments until I get some correspondence. I want all my money refunded and this all cancelled OR add in my exams like YOUR employees made me believe!

I feel like they don‚Äôt care about me, and that they don‚Äôt care that this has affected my mental health... they‚Äôve left me in the lurch. This is just a small part of their mission statement ‚Äò At learndirect we want to help people reach their goals‚Äô- you as a company have failed me and gone against your promises.

headline: Tutor feedback is abysmal
reviewBody:
Tutor feedback is abysmal. Lacking in any valuable advice. For one unit I was told my draft was really good and very detailed, and to submit it straight away. I did and failed. The feedback was that my work was not detailed enough. The tutor was also the assessor.  Very frustrating that she failed me on the very thing she‚Äôd praised the work for, while advising me to submit it. Trying to get decent feedback is like pulling teeth. Also trying to get help and advice on other matters leaves you with similar feelings. Passed from pillar to post, before being referred back to the person you emailed for advice in the first place, then that person says they can‚Äôt help and refers you to someone else again. It‚Äôs like they really can‚Äôt be bothered to deal with you once they have your money. I would not recommend Learn Direct to anyone looking for an online platform for their course. When you attempt to cancel the course because of their poor service, you‚Äôre then charged 50% of the remaining balance. A bit rich in my eyes, when their poor service is the reason you want to withdraw.
It should also be noted that they offer the chance to win a free course if you review them on here as soon as you start your course. Of course, feeling excited about your new course, you give them a decent review, with no real idea of what's coming, in the hope that you‚Äôll win. I feel this is why they score so well on their rating. Please be aware of this before signing up. If you look at the good reviews, most of them are new students.

headline: Signed up to further my career and give‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Signed up to further my career and give myself more career opportunities.

headline: Avoid At Every Cost! MUST READ.
reviewBody:
Avoid at every cost! signing up is easy, Charlie made it very easy for me to pass over bank details and a ¬£9.99 payment, when it comes to cancelling the course due to circumstances changing your requested to either Call the number on the website or request a call back, if you try to call them after 8 minutes it goes through to a voicemail that nobody listens to and if you request a call back you are asked to click a time slot, guess what? nobody calls back! so today i decided to go on the online chat and say i'm interested in a course can someone call me please, guess what? someone called me, it was Charlie again. It seems that they are eager to take your money but not so eager to answer the phone when either you need help or want to cancel. In the end i have ended up calling my bank to block all transactions with Learn Direct, maybe they could compose a course on how to answer the phone? After reading some of the other negative reviews on Trust Pilot i was concerned that nobody can get through to either cancel or get help, being made to feel thick by the course leaders. 

Very disappointed that it has come to this, advertising the course as being the cheapest on the net when it isn't should be a crime also.

Shame on you Learn Direct, i hope one day this review will Direct you into Learning some customer care and manors.

I particularly liked the section where they explained what your next steps would need to be should you consider pursuing a career within that area of study. I found it extremely useful. After enrolling, I was sent my login details within seconds and was able to begin learning straight away which I thought was brilliant service as with some other online learning services I have used I have had to wait weeks (sometimes months) before the course material became available.

headline: course is fine, employees are terrible
reviewBody:
The customer service is great when they're trying to get you to purchase the course but it quickly goes downhill after that. 
I'm halfway through my access course and can't wait to be done with the staff that work here. 
The assessors are sarcastic and make you feel stupid if you ask them to clarify a question or explain their feedback in further detail. I got told "it's common knowledge and I should know that". They are there to help you but it's obvious they don't want to. 
They make you feel guilty for asking for extensions for genuine reasons and tell you off as if you're a naughty child in school and not a paying, adult customer with real life issues. I think the assessors forget they're speaking to paying customers not teenage students. 
The customer service department and "Learner Support" (if it can even be called that) are blunt and completely uninterested in what you have to say and don't call you back if you request it.
For spending over ¬£1000 on a course I would expect the customer service to be 5 stars but it's literally the worst I've ever experienced from any company. 

The course itself is fine, a lot of work especially if you work as well but it's doable if you plan it out. Just be prepared to not get any help or support!

headline: Do not use this Company
reviewBody: Do not use this Company.  Daughter found course information on this company's website to be in-correct and misleading; customer service advisor also gave in-correct course information.  After taking advisors advice, and signing up, she found course information was different on receiving course contents and tried to cancel.  So far Letters, requests etc. to cancel and arrange refund have been ignored and money still being taken. You will possibly loose all your money as requests for refunds, even within timescales seem to be ignored.  Very poor service.

headline: Don‚Äôt join it‚Äôs a scam‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
If you take your education serious Dont join this company. This company is built on scams, lies and poor educational materials. They‚Äôre very quick to take your money and to enrol but any issues they clearly don‚Äôt care. David cox will lie and twist your word, avoid.

Calling this company will running up your phone bill and to make it worse no one even picks up or  calls you back.

I join at the beginning of may 2020 my agreement was to pay 160.00 monthly however I‚Äôve now received a letter in June 2020 stating I own then 1,446.30 SCAM

I was very excited to start studying with direct learn but nothing but a let down. These people don‚Äôt care about your problem or struggles but just want your money.

This company need to be reported to trading standards for scanning and not meeting education standards.

PLEASE PLEASE if you really takes your education serious DONT join.

headline: Course content wrong
reviewBody:
I bought an English Course for my daughter.  After a week she advised me the course was damaging her confidence as some of the content does not work and some is wrong,  One exercise read and pick out 10 spelling mistakes.  I got the same as my daughter,  I then copied and pasted into word which also picked out the same ten. Answer wrong.

Anyway cancelled and was advise I would have a full refund in 30 days.  37 days pass and it took 45 mins to get in touch, assured email sent and refund would be sorted. 43 days later 2 hours on the telephone advised someone would call back in the next hour, sat all afternoon, no call. Day 44 1hr 30 trying to get through finally spoke to someone who was transferring me to the department that would sort my complaint,   guess what? straight back onto the initial number at the back of the que.   Spoke with trading standards. Complaint actioned.
It is horrendous

headline: Outrageous!!
reviewBody:
Following a conditional uni offer for Sep, I needed to take a functional skills English course to meet the requirements. I was advised to do this by the uni with learn direct. In January after a very brief conversation using the chat window on their website, where I explained I wanted to enrol on this course and why, I was told it cost approx ¬£350 and asked by an agent if they could phone me to take a card payment, which I did. The agent told me I would receive an email with a log in and could go from there, simple?...
I did receive the email with my username and password and this is pretty much the only thing I ever  received from them apart from a brief email about expectations. So, not needing my hand held I began to work through the e-learning, which is, aside from all my other issues with this provider the most awful, frustrating thing I have ever done!! The format is outdated and I found the content disappointing, but I needed it for my place so I continued to work through it. Come April I had finished the online material, much slower than I had expected to, due to how frustrating and absolutely tedious I found it. I scoured my inbox to find some info I had missed from learn direct, there was none. I contacted them via email to explain I had finished the material and what were the next steps as I had never had any guidance or info, I had an email back telling me the name and email of my tutor and to contact her which I did. I was sent a couple of mock papers which I did and returned and then you have the long wait for results and what to do next. I finally managed to book in for a zoom tutorial with my allotted tutor on the 8th June, half way through this it was mentioned that as all the test centres are closed due to covid-19 that I would have to take the exam at home and that would be more expensive?? I asked what was meant by this and was only told at this point, 6 months in!! that there was an exam and I would have to pay extra for this. I asked my tutor how much this was as it was the first I had heard and she said she didn't know. I explained the above to her and she suggested that I contact LD as they should make it very clear that what I paid does not cover the exam, there is an exam and I would have to pay for it. Let me make it very clear, learn direct have never told me anything! When I explained to her, she said an email is normally sent by her with hints and tips etc at the start of the course, I stated I had not had this and she agreed as it was me who had to make contact with her because... I had never had any info. So I contacted learn direct with my obvious issue of not being told that I had to pay and just had a one line email fired back with it's ¬£285, hope that helps. Well it did not! I emailed again and asked why I have never been told any of this before now, why have I never had a receipt, or an invoice or a payment breakdown or anything at all? no reply. This is the beginning of a long pattern now that I email LD and am on the whole ignored. So 2 weeks ago I emailed and explained all of the above, again, that I do not have ¬£285 with no notice, no time to budget or save.  I email them again asking how to escalate this and make a formal complaint, now I get a response, I am assured that this is now being looked in to. Again I have to send multiple emails to ask if this has been looked at, AND finally I am offered a discount of 45% on the exam fee. If this is not acceptable then I have to write a letter to head office. I then agree that it will have to be alright as time is moving on and I need to complete this by the beginning of Sept. What I didn't mention is that I was also only told on the phone tutorial that it is a very long process to book this 3 part exam, a few weeks for the provisional mark, another wait for a confirmed mark and then another month for the certificate. So having accepted the discount of 45% I ask how to book and am sent an email stating it's ¬£285 to book? I email again and say that the discount hasn't been applied and am told it has already been applied as the true cost of the exam is actually ¬£415? Now seen as the learn direct staff can barely reply to an email, I struggle to see how weeks earlier, before I had even asked to complain, when I simply enquired what the price was and was told ¬£285, that the agent could foresee a complaint being made and had already speculatively have applied a discount I had not yet asked for or mentioned? If a discount had been applied would it not have been an idea to put this in the email?
I am absolutely disgusted by this whole arduous process and have found it extremely stressful. 
Maybe I will get a response on here about how they are sorry I'm disappointed?
Providers of any service need to be upfront and honest about all charges, before any money is handed over. I do not dispute that the exam has a cost, my issue is that I was not told this at any point until 6 months in to the course, where I am now trapped!

headline: Absolutely appalling service quick‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Absolutely appalling service quick enough to get you signed up onto a functional skills course for Maths and English but when you want to contact them none answers the phone. After serval voicemails no calls back, no emails back and using the callback function on their website doesn‚Äôt work as none ever calls back!! I have got a conditional offer for Adult Nursing this September which requires me to gain the functional skills Maths and English but due to them not having enough invigilators they do not have any exams apparently until September. There has not been any previous communication about this nothing in the post to myself or no emails which is shocking. When I originally signed up to the course I was told I only needed to give one weeks notice to book an exam which would of given me plenty of time to do the exam and get the results back in time for uni. I am now going to be requesting to cancel my course and go elsewhere where they have plenty of exams available! If I do not do this I will lose my university place. Complete waste of time of a company no care or consideration for students.

headline: Don‚Äôt waste your money! The sales man was quick to take our‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
The sales man was quick to take our money and talked a good talk of what the packages I purchased would provide, along with the support etc. 
The contact number he gave is a waste of time, rang over 10 times, no one answers and left e messages, no ones called me back.
I have left it a week before leaving a review in the hope I would receive a call, but nothing. 
Just provided with a log on details and left to it. Not at all what I was sold. So far this is a waste of money!! And don‚Äôt purchase more than one course, which I did because as soon as you get your log on details, they offer courses with 50% off!

headline: Very disappointed with Learn Direct üò¢
reviewBody:
I started my Level 3 Teaching Assistant  course in February. I had my placement agreed, and was attending regularly, I was making decent head way, progressing really well ahead of deadlines and I was really enjoying my course!

 Unfortunately Covid 19 closed the schools. Which could not be helped but you would think being an online course this wouldn‚Äôt be an issue and students could progress with their online assignments and pick up the practical later when back to school.

Unfortunately this is not the case. As a response to this they will allow students to go ahead and complete assignments, out of sequence, however we are not able to submit for marking. As assignments are marked in ‚Äòorder‚Äô and some are practical based ones.

This is so de motivating that the whole course has come to a stop, and I now have assignments backed up to be marked which I can‚Äôt submit until September. It‚Äôs been a nightmare getting hold of anyone to advise. 

David Cox did email back finally, but offered no resolution to this problem and no indication to the way they mark the assignments will change to match the current situation.

So for now my course is at a stand still and I‚Äôm still paying my monthly payments, which doesn‚Äôt seem right. Payments should be frozen if they can‚Äôt meet the needs of students at this time. 

Surly the students work could be marked according, so we can see our pass percentage increase and pick up the practical in September when our placements commence.

I am not the only student who feels let down by this system, it is very disappointing, and de motivating and not being able to get hold of anyone makes a bad situation 100 times worse!

I was nervous signing up to an online course as I have never done one before. Obtaining my degree (BA hons)  at university and other college qualifications through the local college. Seems I was right to be nervous and wish I hadn‚Äôt enrolled on an online course which is not as it appears.

headline: No contact
reviewBody:

Leave a message but people do not return your call.

headline: Thank you David Cox and Learn Direct
reviewBody:
I am studying HE diploma in Nursing with learn direct and I am thoroughly enjoying the course and making decent headway but this is not the reason for my review 

Recently due to the Covid 19 outbreak I have found myself redundant and due to the uncertainty that we all find ourselves in was a little worried about the course fees

I sent an email to David Cox at Learn Direct explaining the situation and recieved a fast, compassionate reply. We reached an agreement that suited both parties and relieved the pressure on myself financially 

Thank you David and Learn Direct. In these challenging times you have shown your true colours. I am very grateful

Robert Salmon
