headline: Conned??
reviewBody:
Conned

I enrolled on a course yesterday, costing ¬£1600, which is to be paid in instalments, however I realised today, it is not the right course for me
I managed to speak with a representative Zoey this morning, and asked her to cancel the course. 
I have to say, their representatives have an unpleasant attitude. 
However, she sent me the cancellation form to fill in, which I did.
I noticed at the bottom of the form, it said if one of their cancellation team try to call me, to discuss and I miss the call, my cancellation is not valid.
I had my phone by me ALL DAY, nobody called, or emailed to confirm my cancellation. 
Yet I received an email telling me that someone had tried to call me this afternoon. 
I have proof on my phone, nobody called.
I have since tried to get hold of someone over the phone, but nobody answers. I leave messages, but nobody replies. 
After reading the experiences of the others who tried to cancel I assume this company will fraudulently take money from my account?
I will be involving my solicitor in this case.

David, thankyou for your reply, I have now emailed the customer service email you gave me here. 
I have proof that I have cancelled, I have the email with cancellation form from your company, and I have emailed customer services now tonight. All within the 14 days as per your terms and conditions. 
I spoke to a representative too before hand, so I do not expect any money to be taken from my account. I am legally allowed to  cancel and have followed your terms and conditions.

UPDATE 

I NEVER DID GET MY ¬£30 DEPOSIT REFUNDED AS PROMISED BY THIS COMPANY. IT IS  NOW 4 MONTHS LATER. 
VERY GLAD I DIDN'T PAY FOR THE ENTIRE COURSE UPFRONT AS I DOUBT I WOULD HAVE RECEIVED IT BACK EITHER.
YOU ARE A DISGUSTING COMPANY LEARN DIRECT AND READING YOUR REVIEWS, I'M AMAZED YOU ARE STILL ALLOWED TO TRADE. PARTICULARLY WITH YOUR POOR RECENT OFSTED RATING

headline: Don't waste your money
reviewBody:
Don't waste your money 
I feel completely cheated,I paid for an Excel intermediate course .i found the recorded course material lacking however the most disappointing part for me was that over the 27 topics covered in the course material when it came to the test 15 out of the 20 questions were all on fractions. I didn't sign up for a maths course!

I don't know how they select the questions but 15 out of 20 on the fractions automatically fails those with discalculia

headline: THE REVIEWS ARE LIES - AVOID AVOID AVOID - DO NOT BELIEVE THE 5* REVIEWS
reviewBody:
AVOID AVOID AVOID
THE WORST COMPANY I HAVE EVER HAD THE MISFORTUNE OF DEALING WITH.

*** FULL OF FAKE REVIEWS ***
I received an email a day or two after enrolling on my course offering to enter me into a prize draw if I left a 5 star review! Believe me, a ZERO star review is far too much.
Have a look at how many of the 5 star reviews say things like '...just started...', '...looking forward to it...', '...so far, so good...', etc.

I would also recommend looking at the company on glassdoor dot co dot uk (no links allowed on TP) and also, try googling 'learndirect ofsted', pay particular attention to the BBC articles.

I was sold a course that is completely inappropriate as I was told it was for a beginner but a lot of the coursework relies on you already working in such a role!?
I tried calling for days on end with no answer, tried to contact my tutor, who has still not answered after 4 weeks!
I sent numerous emails with limited response and advice to write a letter.
I sent the letter on 18th May and have not even received an acknowledgement on 6th June!
I have sent another email today (6th June) and expect I will not receive a response!
THIS COMPANY IS A FRAUD, THEIR CLAIMS ON THE WEBSITE ARE LIES AND THEIR 'CUSTOMER SERVICE' IS NON-EXISTENT. I AM DISGUSTED WITH LEARNDIRECT!!

**** UPDATE 18th February 2021 ****
I have paid the balance on my account and have emailed demanding the removal of all my personal details from their records. I am glad to final cut ties with this shambolic company. I hope they go under, the world is better off without scam companies like this

***** UPDATE 8TH JUNE 2020 *****
I have tried calling the 'help'line today, no answer - asked to leave a message, which I did, no response to my email but as you can see from the reply below, I have been advised to email them, which I have done, 5 times so far.
To give a timescale - my course started on 16th March, I tried calling several times, left messages for my tutor, sent a 'form' through on the website, still no answer, tried calling and was cut off, eventually spoke to a person on 19th MAY!!! Who requested I send her copies of the emails and approximate dates I called, etc. It is now 8th JUNE! It has been 12 weeks that I have been trying to contact someone and leaving messages. I anticipated some issues due to COVID-19 but it appears this company is just a shambles.

I think the reviews on here are rigged too as I received an email (on the day the course started) asking me to leave a 5 star review for the chance to win a course - as the email states "*You will be entered into a draw and the winner will be drawn and contacted at the end of March 2020. Course up to value of ¬£750.00."
Call me cynical but if I haven't been able to contact them since March, I doubt anyone has won that... also, would they WANT TO?

***** UPDATE 15th June 2020 *****
Having emailed David Cox, I have received no reply, I have also left 2 telephone messages during the week and have had no response, I am not even able to speak to a human-being once again as the line just rings for ages and then asks you to leave a message, just like the first 3 weeks after I started the course. This company is a complete shambles.

***** UPDATE 23rd June 2020 *****
Another week, another lack of response from anyone. I emailed David Cox with times, dates, etc. I didn't keep a record of every single call I have placed to Customer 'Services' as I didn't think I would need to at the start of all this, furthermore after 14 weeks, I think my pen would've run out. I'm very tempted to cancel the Direct Debit, I'm sure they would be in touch then.

***** UPDATE 29TH JUNE 2020 *****
It seems they pay more attention to their Trustpilot review than any emails or phone calls (which they don't answer anyway). I have, maybe as a direct result of the above update or maybe not, received an email today telling me they are sorry for the way I have been treated but essentially 'tough, you've signed a contract and didn't cancel within 14 days' which is an interesting conundrum; if I have been unable to contact anyone despite the numerous emails, phone calls, etc within 14 days - how am I supposed to do it? Short of inventing a time machine, I don't think it is possible. Surely this means, I could sign someone up to a non-existent course and tell them that if they don't contact me within 14 days, they are stuck with it and then simply - NOT ANSWER THE PHONE! Hmmm... maybe I have discovered their business model. I am forced to pay the course off or take legal action. Quite frankly, I have already spent 4 months trying to sort this out so I am just going to pay the money and cut all ties.
Please, do not sign up to a course with this company without first reading the reviews on this site and, if it is 5*, ask yourself, why the massive disparity? For example, there is a review from 'Denise' - "Great service. I‚Äôve only just started my course ...."

headline: THANK YOU FOR THE WONDERFUL CUSTOMER‚Ä¶
reviewBody: THANK YOU FOR THE WONDERFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE SO FAR! So far I have had patronising email, people put the phone down on me for asking questions about the course despite cancelling is still taking payments from my account! Even though I have not received any course content or login details so what I‚Äôm actually paying for is beyond me! If no one has contacted me by Friday evening with a refund then il be invoicing the company for my bills I can no longer pay due to these unorganised baffling bafoons. 11th may 901 am I rang to cancel! Iv asked if I can have copies of the recorded calls due to it being my conversation with them, I have asked what I‚Äôm actually paying for as I have received no correspondence about the course or course content or even log in details and when I asked about them over the phone I had it put down on me! I emailed the same in a present conversation via email with a patronising David cox which all of a sudden I seem to be getting ignored, iv tried to contact them via social media but my posts get deleted and I even tried the online chat where I Was instantly dismissed and was told to call well did he not think I had tried that? It took me 2 days and numerous calls to get through! Even though I left a number of voicemails and IT STILL ISNT RESOLVED! - Thanks for your reply on here David we both know that I already have emailed customer service but you already know this due to your patronising reply, I like how you can reply to me on here but iv had no email back for a week and still no one has contacted me about my account or a refund it‚Äôs been a week! Iv already started seeking legal advice thank you as I will be making an invoice of all the charges I have received due to late payments because you took an unauthorised payment of ¬£180. Your staff assured me my account was cancelled on the 11th May 2020 at 9.02 am see you don‚Äôt even have to go through the phone records iv repeatedly told learn direct the time and date of the call.

headline: Fraudulent organisation.
reviewBody:
Their advisers are fake, advocating for learn direct to make money from victims like us, who went to them thinking they are knowledgeable. They deceive you to register for a course even when you are not supposed to. Both their advisers and manager are not up to date with Universities requirement for admissions.
I found out 4 weeks  after registering with them for a one year course because their advisers gave a wrong advice to me. 
I immediately stopped accessing the online course,  I called them several times, sent emails and posted letter to them. Explained to them I don't need the course because I had been offered an admission by the university contrary to their advice. 
Learn direct has put me into financial, emotional 
and psychological  difficulties since my encounter with them last year. 
They never stopped threatening me with emails, text messages and letters.  They kept taking money from my account. Even though I have spoken to them on several occasions and agreed on what I could pay monthly.  After making such payment, they still take another money from my account contrary to my agreement with them putting me into Financial difficulties. 
Learn direct is fraudulent organisation,  don't trust their advisers. They could go to any length to ensure they deceive you to fall for their lies in order to get your money.
Lois.

headline: Learning made easy.
reviewBody:
From making initial enquiries to enrolling with learn direct, I couldn't have wished for a more supportive learning institution. Everything was fully explained to me and I was supplied with a wealth of knowledge and guidelines to support me through my course. The online learning is easily accessible, clear and precise and help and support is available whenever it is needed.

Plus the courses can be paid in monthly installments making learning more accessible. As does the fact that you can fit in study around work hours or childcare, while working to enhance your career and learning prospects, all from the comfort of your own home. I would absolutely recommend Learn Direct to anyone who may be thinking of learning a new skill or enhancing knowledge of a subject known to them. With Learn direct, you really can't go wrong.

headline: Like it so much I'm on the second course already
reviewBody:
When I chose my first course on LearnDirect I wasn't expecting it to be as enjoyable, informative and focused in the real world as it is. My first course was Welsh, and I am now able to understand the language of the country I live in. And for that Diolch!!
As I was so satisfied with that course I decided to enroll in Teaching Assistant Diploma. The study material is very good, well structured and very easy to understand.
I would definitively recommend LearnDirect to anyone thinking of Online Learning.

headline: Book the correct course
reviewBody:
Used for training staff and booked several courses. The Excel courses are good and I have had some good feedback. I would use again but be very careful with exactly the course you want so if Using Office 365 be 100% that the courses are built on that not older visions. 
The test of a company I believe is when things go wrong 
I booked the wrong course my fault but trying to change is a nightmare, I left messages on the internal email but never received a reply. What would make the difference rather than just taking your money, Learn direct could run a course on customer service and listening skills then go on it themselves.

Lisa Selbieüëç

headline: Level 4 Aromatherapy
reviewBody: I did the Acredited level 4 Aromatherapy course and I really enjoyed it. There's a lot of anatomy and physiology to work though at the beginning and you need to be able to do your own research on oils. The reason it wasn't five stars was only because they don't tell you when you take out monthly payments that they withhold your certificate and acreditation until the course has been paid for in full. Zoey was initially really helpful when I rang to pay for the rest of my course and  Claire has been really helpful in customer services today, when I asked for my final assessment feedback to be released. I'd do another course with this College.

reviewBody: I have used Learn Direct to do my Functional Skills Maths Course. Some of the content could have been presented clearer for interpreting some of the questions, however this was the only issue I encountered. Very friendly and helpful staff, great support, overall a great course.

headline: Awful communication and course content poor service!!!
reviewBody:
Awful communication and course content! 
Absolutely appalling service, not that I would call it 'service'. I bought a course/exam bundle and was appalled at the interface. My husband is an IT professional and also found it appalling, not to mention not working/functioning correctly despite multiple browsers. Simple solution, withdraw and request a refund! Not so simple!. The request for a refund was sent in early April 2020, and as days and weeks passed, no response. Eventually, I started to call combined with emails. Each time I phoned I was told the same thing - " We are processing your refund and it will be with you in 30 days, we have tried to contact your wife" - despite checking the phone number and email held for my wife, no contact was made. Moving on to 30 days, and still no refund. Spoke yet again to Customer 'lack of SERVICE' and was told "yes it should have happened by now" really? Apparently, it is not customer service who deal with refunds, and the department who do do not have a direct contact number (convenient) and who also do not respond to emails, despite being given their 'not so direct' email address. Finally, spoken to customer 'lack of SERVICE" again today and was told (well at least she phoned me back this time, unlike the other times) that having spoken to the refund team, they do not know when it will be refunded and did not provide a reason for not having it yet, and for not knowing when we will get it. My husband said we just both write a poor review and they said "well we don't want to receive a bad review" well guess what people, don't provide an atrocious service and you wont get them. So here is my review!! And someone commented on my husbands review a David within 5 minutes of review going live saying to email him to discuss this and surprise surprise when we emailed..... NO RESPONSE!!  Final status - still waiting for a refund (currently today Friday 15/05/2020 at 12 days over the 30 day time allotted, and with no idea when or why we have not received it. TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

headline: New students avoid
reviewBody: I originally had a very good view of Learn direct, I am still enrolled on the Counselling Skills Certificate Course, to enable me to get onto a university masters (I am a registered general adult nurse but needed a qualification relating to mental health to get accepted onto a psychology masters). However although they advertise support, customer service barely pick up the phone, barely answer the emails and tutors don't get back to you. I am currently on assignment 3 out of 4 and I am still waiting on a reply to my 7th email in 3 weeks that has gone unresponsive to, I cant get through on the phones, social media to even raise a complaint or chase my lack of support further. So for now I'd advise you to not join learn direct as they cant even look after the "students" they have, waste of ¬£600 as I cant progress with my current assignment until I can clarify how a paperbased course that I have to send in the post (why in 2020) wants me to submit a role play. As a nurse I am aware that Covid19 has slowed down services, however they are working from home and emails are easily replied to, id expect a delay in a response in a few days but 3 weeks, absolutely appalling.

headline: Shelly was outstanding!
reviewBody: I contacted Shelly because I realised the course I had applied for was not really suitable and I did not have the placement of systems to fulfill the requirements. I was extremely stressed because after much persuasion work has paid a lot of money for a course I knew I would not be able to complete. I contacted Learn Direct as a lifeline hoping they could help me find some light at the end of the tunnel and I spoke to a lady named Shelly. She was extremely helpful and reassuring. I explained the situation and due to me only completing a small part of the course I was allowed to change to a more suitable one! I was extremely grateful for shellys help, she was reassuring and emailed me personally with my options. I asked questions and nothing was ever too much. She was very helpful and so efficient calming me back less than 5 minutes after I sent her an email. Thanks so much for all your help Shelly!

headline: A+++
reviewBody: Zoey from the call center was lovey - very polite and helpful, sorted out my quiry in minutes and i was on my way - will use learndirect again

headline: 100% Recommend
reviewBody:
After now completing my studies with you, I wanted to share my feedback. 

As someone who had been working for a couple of years, it wouldn‚Äôt of been possible for me to go back to college full time to complete a course. However, I desperately wanted to go to university to pursue my dream of becoming a Paramedic. 

I didn‚Äôt even know distance learning was a thing, but when I searched online, it was clear to me that Learn Direct was the best The customer service team have been great right from the start.

I have had a great experience with Learn Direct, I completed my course in just over 6 months, I‚Äôve had lots of reassurance from the Access to HE managed, and the assessors have offered so much support and great feedback which I will carry through with me to university. 

Thanks to Learn Direct, I received 5/5 conditional offers from universities for Paramedic Science. I‚Äôm excited to receive my final results in July. 

I have recommended you to lots of people, including my boyfriend who has recently signed onto the L3 Personal Trainer course with you. 

Thank you for offering me a great experience.

headline: Excellent  Service
reviewBody:
After several attempt to speak to someone because I wanted to do a swap of course, I finally manage to speak to one of the Customer Service Advisor ( Zoey Ware). She was very helpful and efficient. It didn't take long for her to get back to me on my swap of course. She was well verse with the course information as I needed more clarification.
Now I am ready to start the course...
Keep up the good, friendly & efficient customer service Zoey.

headline: Fantastic Service
reviewBody:
I have been with Learn Direct for a few months now as a student and have had a great experience from the start. 

The help I have received during enrolment was great and all correspondence from tutors has been professional, timely and extremely helpful. 

Today, I spoke with Ian Allison who helped me to resolve a small issue that I had. Again, he was very helpful, friendly and understood straight away what the issue was and how to sort it out. 

Overall, a wonderful service and I wouldnt hesitate to use them again personally or to recommend to a friend or colleague.

headline: I email Zoey yesterday from learn‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
I email Zoey yesterday from learn direct with regards to changing my course and she was back to me straight away. We had a few correspondence throughout the day and by last night I was logged onto my new course. I set up my new repayment plan over the phone this morning with Zoey and it's all sorted in less than 24 hours.
Zoey was a great help and so nice. Could not ask for better.
Thank you for all your help.

headline: I phoned learndirect
reviewBody:
I phoned learndirect, as I was concerned about not making the payment for April, due to a lack of funds. I spoke to a very nice advisor on the other end, and explained my circumstances. She spoke to her manager and got straight back to me. learndirect was very sympathetic and understanding to my situation, and we was able to find a solution. Thank you Zoey and your colleagues at learndirect. 
I would definitely recommend them to anyone.

headline: I am giving two stars simply because i‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
I am giving two stars simply because i love my course and where it is going to get me in life. Course material is perfect in my opinion although some of the tutors could do with a kick up the bum in regards to support and help! Im working my way though it nicely and the website is easy to navigate. 

As for customer service i have never known a company like it! I sent an email to the finance department a month ago and am still yet the get a response! Dont bother requesting a call back ive been trying that for 3 weeks! When you call you only get 3 mins on the phone before being sent to voicemail and if you leave one it will be ignored. Today i finally managed to get through to someone who clearly had just rolled out of bed working from home! She was rude and very unhelpful! Long pauses between what i was saying and what she was saying hasnt got a clue how to do her job! I was asking about the advanced learner loans available as we are struggling financially during covid-19 and she sniggered at me whilst telling me they are no longer accepted when i sounded shocked that the website says otherwise!! 
Do you accept them or not?? Either update your staff or update your website! 

Quick enough to take your money but no financial help whatsoever during hard times! 

If there was a complaint option on the phone line - which there isnt- I would have made one about the rude lady who i spoke to today!! 

Before enrolling do some research! Luckily i am quite an independant person who doesnt often have to call customer support but for someone who needs more contact and support then this company would be no use at all. 

Like i said the acrual course and its material i cant fault one bit and im so glad i enrolled but i just think for the amount we actually pay we should be treated with a bit more respect

headline: Had the  wonderful opportunity to talk‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Had the  wonderful opportunity to talk to Claire. She went above and beyond to help me. Without her help, I would have given up. So just want to say a HUGE THANK YOU to Claire. Would recommend learn direct to anyone who wants to learn something new online.

headline: Immediate response and query solved‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Immediate response and query solved straight away. Thank you.

headline: I am a new student with Learn Direct‚Ä¶
reviewBody: I am a new student with Learn Direct currently on Level 3 in Advice and Guidance.  So far the support and guidance has been excellent.  There was a small hiccup when reading the Learner Handbook in that it is outdated in parts especially at the beginning when it asks you set up your profile and the course to be tailored specifically to you - that no longer exists on the new platform, both Zoey and Sue Gunner were very helpful and explained everything clearly and fully.  I am looking forward to continuing with my course (started reading it today) and to submitting all my assignments extra early since we are on Lockdown.  Thank you all supporting staff I really appreciate any help, advice and guidance that I am given - you are all doing an excellent job :-)

headline: Potentially comitting violations of contractual agreements
reviewBody: I decided last year (around october) to study a biochemistry diploma. I had a pop up on the website with a man who persistently tried to persuade me into the course. I then agreed and he took a ¬£20 deposit. Because of my mental health and financial sitaution at the time I felt I was unable to complete the course and phoned up to cancel. The man on the phone assured me I had cancelled, but here we are and I have a threatening letter saying I owe ¬£1,444 because I cancelled AFTER the 14 day grace period. LearnDirect have no reccolection nor records of said phone call even though I have on numerous attempts told them I had cancelled. (In hindsight I WISH I had recorded that phone call). Now here I am. Unable to still pay with this current circumstances affecting the economy and my wage. Yet the advisors keep persisting I did not cancel and that I now need to pay ¬£120.33 per month for a course I have not opened nor enaged in ONCE. So why am I being charged? They have NO costs associated with my course as I have not completed ANY materials nor used a tutor that they offer. So I have cost them NOTHING. The way they speak to you is atrocious, no sympathy, hardly ANY understanding of current circumstances. Surely they'd take initiative and think that if a person hasn't opened the course or used any material nor done ant coursework/assignments after 7 months of being enrolled. That they had cancelled or were not planning on completing the course. I ended up blocking their number as my anxiety cannot deal with these people. They're making me feel increasingly depressed and more suicidal with each threatening letter they send. I spoke to CAB about the letters and even they agreed that they come off as over-threatening and harrassing and that they are potentially breaching the law with their methods of retrieval. I have no plans on paying for this course and would advise EVERYONE that unless you're 110% sure you want to learn with them, I'd avoid them like the plague.

headline: Learn Direct make learning accessible to everyone
reviewBody: Learn Direct has literally given me access to better myself, and the support to actually achieve it, at a time I was struggling for both confidence and funds.  Through their payment plan, the online portal and the support their tutor has given me, alongside my placement supervisor, I have been able to complete my course in just under 12 months and achieve my level 3 teaching assistant qualification.  The portal is easy to use and the structured sheets help you stick close to what is required for each unit.  I highly recommend Learn Direct to anyone looking to study alongside their work or family commitments

headline: Waste of money !!!!!! With incorrect grammar
reviewBody:
Dear Learn Direct

I am very disappointed in the learning package English level 2 . English is my home language and hold a medical diploma level 5 ,but I need to obtain a Level 2 equivalent to GCSE for UK application for university, hence my reason for purchasing your product ,but it has not met my expectations as a learning tool.
Firstly, I notice that some of the questions use incorrect grammar or having spelling mistakes. You are given a score at the end of each section but at no time does the program let you know where you have gone wrong and why so  ? At the end of the session you have learnt nothing other than you have given the incorrect answer - this does not enhance your learning.

I challenged my English speaking 63 year old mum who has worked as a PA / Administrator for 45 years as well as another professional working friend to see how they scored  with the sessions and guess what they both failed level 1/2  and agreed that the program is not helpful as it doesn't teach you anything and neither of them could fathom where they had gone wrong and why when they both have English qualifications.

I think the course has been a waste of my time and money.  I have not learnt anything.  It has caused me frustration and anxiety and I am no closer to achieving my goal which is to obtain a GCSE ‚Ä¶..

In view of the above I  would like a refund because the course is and not helpful at all ,considering it's to teach English and holds incorrect grammar and spelling errors I am truly disappointed . I Have also tried to use the message service to send this message with no avail due to it does not work! 
I have emailed Aswell with no avail . I paid upfront ¬£240.00

headline: Learn direct appear to be very good
reviewBody:
Learn direct appear to be very good, until you have a problem!

 I signed up to a course on 23rd February 2020, I then decided, after 5 days to cancel this course as is my statutory right to do so within 14 days. Learn direct did try to retain me as a customer but I remained firm on canceling. They then took 1 week to confirm via email that they had cancelled my course, they then advised that my refund would take up to 30 days!! In what world does it take 30 days to process a refund? 

From the 5th of March, I have awaited my refund which Learn Direct have failed to provide. I have called them and left 2 voicemail plus an email. 

Today I realised that if you press 2 on their options when calling (existing customers) nobody answers and you are prompted to leave a voicemail, but if you press option 1, (new customers) somebody answers instantly! This just shows exactly where their priorities are, if they've had your money - they don't care about you! 

Upon speaking to a man using option 1, he transferred me to customer services, they stated that I should have been refunded and she needed to speak to accounts, I asked how she was going to get back to me, as she seemed very keen to get me off the phone, she stated that she would get back to me via email later today, she HASN'T! 

I have had my money stolen by Learn Direct, and now I have to chase them daily to find out where it is? It's an absolute joke, I would also like to add that they have plagued my phone and emails asking where MY payment is for the course! I cancelled after 5 days! This is nothing to do with the current world situation, my refund was requested way before that. I would NEVER use them again. 

Where is my money???

UPDATE: 20TH APRIL 2020

Today, just when I thought that Learn Direct could not get any worse, they did! 
I received a threatening letter from them, stating that I owe them ¬£334 for the complete course amount because I cancelled my direct debit! 

As previously stated, I cancelled well within the 14 day cooling off period. I then had to open a claim with my bank to get the money back that Learn Direct had taken out of my account, my bank refunded the money after only 2 days because I had proof in the form of an email, stating that Learn Direct had accepted my cancellation. 

I cannot believe that this company operates in such a dreadful manner. I had hoped that my dealings with them were over forever, but apparently not. 

STEER WELL CLEAR! NOBODY NEEDS CHASING FOR DEBTS THAT THEY DON'T OWE IN A WORLD CRISIS, WE CERTAINLY HAVE ENOUGH TO COPE WITH. 

Dreadful company, I will return my letter from them with a very strongly worded response! More time, distress  and effort at my expense.

P.s Learn Direct, don't you DARE respond to this as if you give a toss or respond to people's emails- neither are applicable in your case!

headline: I felt stuck in a rut!
reviewBody:
I have felt stuck in a rut for a long time now, feeling like I wanted to try something new; but didn't know what. I knew I liked playing with computers and creating worksheets, so I decided to look for a job that involved those skills. 

Everything I was interested in needed a qualification; I felt defeated before I had even started. I needed to re do my English GCSE before even thinking about the required course. Luckily I was already signed up to Learn Direct whom I had recently received an email off offering a FREE! course. I checked it out and enrolled on The English Level 2 Functional Skills. 

The course is amazing, very easy to follow and explains the content extremely well. I have always struggled with English but actually feel like its sinking in. This isn't the best part I also spoke to James on the Learn Direct online chat, he advised me there was no interest to pay! no credit checks! and the first payment wouldn't be due until the 1st of May! but wait there's more! (as quoted in the film Scream) James also said there was an offer on the course I had chosen, 40% off! WOW! All I had to pay was ¬£9.99 enrolment. I was so happy I was able to book onto the course I needed and do the Functional Skills along side it for FREE! 

I have already submitted some assignments, my tutor Jill has given very thorough feedback and its easy to contact her to if I need to. Thanks Learn Direct! Being in Lock down due to Covid -19 doesn't feel so isolating any more.

headline: A really good experience and service from Learndirect
reviewBody:
A really well organised and supportive course provider .

This is my first time taking an online course and I'm really enjoying it . Learndirect make it really easy to find a course that will benefit you and offer great deals suited to your budget. 

Once you start your course they keep in contact and offer you support if you need it. It's also very easy to get in touch with the right person to help you should you need it.

Ive found course material to be really well laid out and up to date. On your course you will have a tutor who again is very easy to get in touch with and is always happy to help . 

It's been a really good experience with Learndirect and I'd happily take another course with them .

headline: Fantastic!

After completing my current course I will most defiantly look for other courses to complete as its simple to use. Fantastic!

headline: Terrible customer service and no refund forthcoming
reviewBody:
Initially when I signed up for an online counselling course in March 2020 I was dealt with very well - not surprisingly as I was buying one of Learndirect's products.  The operations manager and one other managed the enrolment process.  I found another more suitable course within the 14 day 'cooling off' period and contacted the operations manager and the staff member to cancel the course, returning unsigned the agreement for the monthly subscription.  I accepted that I would lose the ¬£9.99 deposit paid initially.  I checked my bank statements recently and was horrified to see that 6 x ¬£45.75 monthly payments had been taken from my account.  I have never activated the course nor intended to.
I immediately called Learndirect and there followed many phone calls, emails and ultimately 2 complaint letters from me, one of which mysteriously went astray.  I sent the second letter by recorded delivery and confirmed its safe delivery.  I heard nothing further and once again for the hundredth time contacted Learndirect.  The operations manager with whom I originally dealt was also dealing with my complaint at this stage and sent me a short email saying he thought by cancelling my subscription and closing the course the matter had been satisfactorily dealt with.   This was absolutely not the case.
I had a further exchange of emails with him and others culminating in one representative stating randomly he thought 'James' had offered me another course.  I was also emailed the activation code for the course!
I am in touch with a legal body to pursue this further as I have reached my limit with the level of anxiety caused by this prolonged and agonising contact with Learndirect.
Thanks Trustpilot for allowing me to vent these feelings of frustration and misery!
NB.  I have just received a letter from Learndirect stating that I have been enrolled on the course for too long to be offered a refund or cancellation!!  They can offer a course change and an adfitional course for me or a family member.  I just want my money back Learndirect!!!!

headline: Scam. They do nothing to support their students
reviewBody: At the beginning they said they will allow to me to register in a childcare course even though I did not secure a placement in a nursery and they said they will allow me to start doing the theory part of the course until things ease up from Covid-19. Then I realised that I cannot submit any of the assignments unless I do the practical part too. I have contacted them so many times and they say there is nothing they can do!I am facing a frustrating problem that it seems like no one is planning to resolve. I have spoken on the phone to different people and they all mentioned that there is nothing they can do. When I am going through my lessons, theory questions are connected with practical ones that cannot be completed unless a placement is secured in a nursery setting. Even though all the units are open and I can work on the theory questions, I am unable to get any feedback from my assessor because she says I cannot submit the assignment when the practical questions are missing. I have offered to volunteer full time in nursery settings but all refused due to Covid 19 and they are reducing the number of paid workers let aside volunteers. I was very excited at the beginning to complete the theory questions so I did for 6 units but I cannot keep going when I am unable to get any feedback from my assessor. How am I expected to finish 23 units not knowing if what I am doing is the right thing? I understand that it is my responsibility to secure a placement but it is Learndirect responsibility to mark my assignments that are based on theory questions.¬† I have spoken to different students who are doing the same course with different providers and all of them said that even though they are facing the same problem regarding practical questions, they are still getting feedback on the theory questions that they have completed and their work is marked and signed off. At least they know they are progressing and on their way to complete the course, unlike me who is just stuck and unable to get any feedback on any part of my work.

headline: Ignoring refund emails!
reviewBody: I cancelled my course within the correct time period due to finding out the course was uninsurable after completion and that my local college offered a better course for free! (One which would allow me to be insured and probably wouldn‚Äôt be full of spelling mistakes or grammatical errors like this one)  All was fine, I completed the cancellation process and was assured I‚Äôd receive a refund for my deposit within 30 days... well I‚Äôm on day 35, no refund and all emails are being ignored and you cannot get through on the phone. Absolutely terrible service.

headline: Very Disappointing
reviewBody: I booked a course with Learndirect and agreed to pay ¬£140 per month for 10 months, after 16 days and with me never starting the course I realised I needed to cancel or postpone the course due to my income being massively affected by the Corona virus outbreak. It took 2 days of me attempting to contact them via Facebook, there chat facility, telephone and email, eventually to be told I had missed there 14 day cancellation period by 2 days and therefore they won‚Äôt help me, not at all.

headline: Log in problems resolved
reviewBody:
I had to contact the number given as I could not log into the course I am currently doing. I thought perhaps that my time had run out and the course had closed automatically. I spoke to Sue Gunner who talked me through the process of using a different browser and resent my log in and set a new password as it had been so long, I didn't even know where to look for it. She reassured me that I still had plenty of time to complete the course and advised me to keep in touch even if I haven't carried out any work. She also sent me a handy guide to stop blocking pop ups.
Sue was extemely pleasant to speak to and understood my problem straight away. I am so grateful to her and am now able to get on with my coursework while I have lots of time at home. Thank you. All the best!

headline: Happy ending
reviewBody: I enrolled on my course a few weeks ago but did not log on for a long time. I tried contacting Customer Services, but was asked to send an email after holding for 3 minutes. I sent an email but got no reply,so tried going on live chat. I was given a number to call support, which I did. I got through to Sue Gunner, who couldn't have been more helpful and efficient, even staying on the line until I was logged in. Extremely pleasant manner too! Started a bit slowly so only a four but ended happily!

headline: ABOVE AND BEYOND STAFF THAT YOU HAVE
reviewBody:
I would like to inform you that you have an above and beyond member of staff by the name of Zoey Ware, customer service. I phoned to complain about my course and was all stressed out to find the change of career was not happening and asked to be moved to a course that I work within.

Zoey was so calm and polite at all times and was able to resolve my issue and update me along the way. With everything going crazy within the world right now, she still managed to keep calm and polite with me at all times. 

I really feel that I am not praising her another but she really is an asset to you, and staff like Zoey are hard to come by these days. The old saying smile when you are on the phone as customers can sense this. I can honestly say that Zoey smiled all the way and if she were not she never would let you know.

Thank you for all that you have done for me and for booking me on for my Law Foundation Course.

headline: Absolutely loved the CACHE level 3‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Absolutely loved the CACHE level 3 Teaching Assistant Course! As a result if taking this course I had a job within 2 months of starting. It taught me so much about how schools work as organisations and the importance of safeguarding children. I am now a qualified teaching assistant, I had no trouble completing the course even though the last time I studied was around 14 years ago. Great tutors, positive feedback and help given if needed and always someone on the end of the phone. Highly recommend studying with them!

headline: Poor customer service, atrocious learning experience. Run while you can!
reviewBody:
Poor, poor customer service. Even poorer learning experience.

Pretending to deliver online solutions for courses which their so called tutors are not suited to deliver in such format, generic feedback, unable to be specific when pointed out and arsy attitude when challenged on this! Their systems cannot support modern day technology, file formats are changed when updated and their IT illiterate tutors are unable to see or open, therefore blaming it on the student as no evidence provided. Also be prepared never to pass your assignment if you give them constructive feedback in any form. Absolute waste of my time, resources and money. 

They tell you one thing then never deliver, when you try contact accounts or customer services prepare yourself for at least 6 weeks and two complaints before you get a dismissive answer. Adviser on the telephone promised they would arrange for ¬£100 cashback as I paid for my course. Nothing was ever done about this and my several emails have been ignored about the matter.

As a learning professional myself, I can't stress this enough. Stay away from Learn Direct.

headline: Very happy with the service!
reviewBody: Super easy for me as my finance department at my workplace  enrolled me on the course. Email with log in details sent straight through to my email and I started my course the same day! I have also received an email asking if I need support or advice with contact details, I have not taken you up on the offer as the course is set out in such a simple format. Units are easy to submit and in my case have been marked (with useful/constructive feedback by tutor) on the same day! All in all very happy with the service provided and course content! It's a five from me :)

headline: Thankfully the bank agreed !!!
reviewBody:
My daughter and I shared the cost of Functional skills level 2 course, she needs this to complete a dental nurse apprenticeship, the day after purchase we realised it was not C&G, her tutor advised it was not suitable, C&G is a different format. I contacted David Cox (Customer Service) he assured me I could have a refund as my daughter had not logged onto the course, what he conveniently didn‚Äôt tell me was the letter I had to send recorded delivery to cancel the course had to be sent on a time scale, they received the letter 1 day late and refused any refund ¬£250 Half of it my daughters hard earned cash.
Shocking customer service, contacted the bank and they agreed we should have been entitled to a Refund, they pursued and we had a refund. Do not use unless 100% sure of the course your purchasing.

headline: I already wrote in many times...
reviewBody:
I already wrote in many times to the same email address but no positive response at all so not sure why I‚Äôm asked to send in the same details several times.
No-body responds positively or will take responsibility of what was advised by Learndirect team members anyway. 

Reply received from Learndirect as follows on my previous review which is useless:
 
Reply from learndirect Limited
10 Feb 2020
Thanks for your feedback Shabnam, I'm sorry to hear you have been disappointed with the service here. If you'd like to detail all of your concerns in writing to customer services email, we will be sure to assist you further.

headline: Ofcom rated them 'Inadequate' and I've‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Ofcom rated them 'Inadequate' and I've learnt why. Their Online courses are a joke! I purchased their maths and English level 2, the maths was completely full of basic errors that made much of the material useless and their English course is just terrible! The way things are explained make little to no sense and genuinely feel I have gone backwards since I started this course as now all my prior knowledge has been confused by their useless course material. Customer service is zero as well, as I emailed them 4 days ago and still haven't recieved a response. Would not reccommend.

headline: Imagine...
reviewBody:
Imagine, on your 44th birthday you decide to finally take the plunge, follow your dream and train to become a teacher.  As a person who was brought up with a challenging home life, the opportunities just weren't there for me to follow my dream when I was younger. Fast forward to 19.1.2020- the day I decide to do something for me! My home life is now amazing, I no longer have 'young' children who need me every second of the day and I have a supportive husband who thinks what a better time to make my dream come true!  
After doing some research, I found the Higher Education Diploma run by learn direct seemed to be my best option. Upon speaking to Harry at LD, I knew I had made the right decision. He was knowledgeable and genuinely excited about me starting my journey...infact we had a great chat.  I can't wait to move forward to the next chapter in my life and am grateful to LD for creating this opportunity for me.

headline: The 5 stars given are to Sue Lawrence‚Ä¶
reviewBody: The 5 stars given are to Sue Lawrence and Sue Lawrence only!! After MONTHS of trying to get someone to help me, I finally got through to this lovely lady who has helped me. Not a single other person did, nor even replied to me. Thank you Sue Lawrence, you are clearly a one off at learn direct, everyone else could learn a lot from you!!

headline: Big mistake
reviewBody: I decided to enrolled in a course I could benefit from in the future however I was offered a now job and simply would not have time to do the course ( because of the travel time). So I sent a letter within the 14days to cancel my course, the letter was received however I had no contact or help if they have have actually done it and reading these reviews I am worried. I was going to start the course when I started driving as I would have had more time but I‚Äôm really not going to now. It‚Äôs a joke that they give you attention and help with your needs just for your money but then ignore you after. I have emailed so many staff but no response. Very unhappy and will not be taking their courses in future. Do not make the same mistake!

headline: Functional skills maths
reviewBody:
I needed to retake my maths again so I could get into university. When I looked on the website it was very clear and informative, so I enrolled onto the course and my mentor Linda Hart was AMAZING!!! Maths has always been a scary concept for me but she has made me feel that I can pass the exam, (which I am now currently revising for). She has built my confidence on maths loads. I can't praise her enough.

Also, when I wanted to pay and enrol on the course/exam, the staff on the other end of the phone were fab! Very friendly and always happy to answer any questions (no matter how silly it was)

headline: Looking for a course to help me get into university
reviewBody:
Was looking for a course to help me get into university, found the website very simple and easy to use, just started my course so far so good it is very informative and easy to understand and progress through.

Can't wait to get stuck in.

headline: What a star!
reviewBody:
What a star! Lauren Barlow helped me so much today and has put my mind at ease. She was professional, patient and very knowledgeable.
Once I have finished this course I will be looking into another. Thank you again!!

headline: Lauren was patient and empathic
reviewBody: Lauren was patient and empathic to my tech issue, she reassured me that I didn't need to hurry. I immediately felt confident. She emailed me a solution but it didn't troubleshoot the issue enough so another quickly answered telephone call led to her talking me through another approach, step by step and in less than 3 minutes I was away watching my course tutorials, learning. Awesome. Thank you, not at all a hassle!

headline: Thank you.Very nice customer service
reviewBody:
Thank you.Very nice customer service, both through phone and emails.This morning, within just 2 rings, Miss Lauren Barlow picked up the phone and in just 10 min she found a solution to the problem, after another 5 min I received an email with the requested information.
All the way she has been  very supportive, great sense of humor.
I am happy with my level 3 course.

headline: Not all superheroes wear capes!
reviewBody:
Not all superheroes wear capes but i feel Charlie has one anyway! 

He was fantastic helping me at the last minute yesterday, over the new year I had been thinking about a new start and he explained everything and put my mind at ease, quick to come back with anything I needed to know or wasn‚Äôt sure of. 

He was calm and very knowledgeable about everything with clear explanations of what was needed. We managed to get everything set and ready, what was even more impressive was that he managed to to this while I was at work and when it came to complete the set up he was happy to quick chat to my girlfriend who was upset that she didn‚Äôt get to chat to him more.

He is a credit to the team, a true gentleman and an amazingly positive person. 
A genuine lovey fella who clearly wants to help others. 

Thanks Charlie you utter legend!

headline: The enrolling process couldn't have‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
The enrolling process couldn't have gone better. 
After a lengthy conversation and me practically grilling the guy on the phone with a thousand questions, he put my mind at ease and told me every single thing I wanted to know.
It was very refreshing to have someone so friendly and down to earth discuss the course with me, I would highly recommend to anyone looking at doing a course,  you're in the right place!

headline: Ups and downs
reviewBody: Been a bit of a mixed experience so far. When I initially enrolled I was told the course I had booked, included all exams. After speaking with my course tutor I was told this was not the case. To get the exams added this cost me a significant amount, although I did get discount because of the mix up. Liam was extremely helpful with this. Onto the course itself, there is a lot of content that you get given however, only your two mock exams are marked and feedback provided. The end of module tests don‚Äôt provide you with feedback on what answers you got wrong, how are you meant to improve if you don‚Äôt know where you went wrong?! In the future if I decide to do more courses I think I will look for another company to go with.

headline: So far I have received good customer‚Ä¶
reviewBody: So far I have received good customer service. I found the course cheaper elsewhere and I have been offered the chance to match the price. I was told if I put a deposit down I could change my mind within 14 days but when I came to change my mind after a few hours in was told the deposit was nonrefunadable and I'd have to cancel in writing by post which was not explained to me; I was lead to believe I could just change my mind within 14 days easier than the actual process. Overall I've found the price competative so I'm happy so far

headline: Just do it!!
reviewBody:
Just do it!!
So I was procrastinating for few months whether to do a course and what course to do. There are so many different courses to choose from, but I am so glad I made the decision to do the Child Psychology course. I have only just started my first assignment and feel like I have already retained alot of knowledge! The website is very easy to use and there is alot of information to help support me with my assessments.
Learn direct customers service team are so amazing especially Simon, he made sure I was happy and understood everything without being pushy, even though it took me a very very long time to decide what to go for. I definitely look forward to doing a few more courses with Learn direct in the future...

headline: Career change
reviewBody:
After thinking about a new career and speaking to family and friends I made the decision to become a foot health practitioner. 
The theory part was excellent and very informative and next week I attend my practical to become a newly qualified FHP. 
The support I received is fantastic not just from tutor feedback but when I have called regarding finances and other information I received great support. 
Only putting 4 stars purely as I have yet to finish and do my practical but I am quiet certain that I will get the support and enjoy it as much as the rest of the course. I will highly recommend the course and company.

reviewBody:
Miss Sold Course

I bought some courses for my Wife 2 months ago. At the point of paying, at no point was I (the person buying) made aware that this did not include the Exams. I was told only after I paid that they were another ¬£250. To say I was unhappy was an understatement (As plainly heard on the call)

I called back to then book these exams a few weeks later to find out they are now ¬£700 +!!! but with their discount it could come down to ¬£380. 

I made a formal complaint as I felt this had been completely miss sold to me. he Operations Manager, who I can only imagine as Rodney from Only Fools and Horses, assumes I did know... even though he's listened to the calls and knows I was never told. He has then proceeded to deliberately ignore my calls and emails for weeks. 32 days and counting and still no resolution.

Long story short, miss selling courses, no customer services, no after care. Just get you to pay and then they couldn't care less. 

The Operations Manager shouldn't be in this role if this is how he sets an example to a team working underneath him.

headline: Says tutor support 24/7 with a number‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Says tutor support 24/7 with a number and email address !! ..the number is customer service who just ask you to email, then can take a few days for a response... So its not exactly 24/7 tutor support is it! Course contents good, but struggle to see how you can be trained to an adequate level with no practical assessment with many courses.

headline: no refund given as promised
reviewBody: Charged twice for the same course. Cancelled course in writing due to the more expensive one repeating much of the same content as their much cheaper alternative. Was told I‚Äôd be refunded within 30 days but have had to chase and still no refund. They have over ¬£700 of mine and it looks like I‚Äôm not the only one to suffer this dreadful customer service when it comes to refunds. I will be taking legal action if I‚Äôm not repaid this week.

headline: Value for money
reviewBody: Staff are very informative, polite, friendly and professional. They answer quickly to mu queries. The informations are very helpful up to date and easy to understand. I would love to get another course for sure! Its worth the money. You will feel valued and treated fairly.

headline: Absolutely disgusted with Learn Direct‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Absolutely disgusted with Learn Direct I signed up for an access to nursing course but I have now lost my job, I also have not been able to log in to the course material as my employment at the time meant working 14 hour shifts, I am a single Mother with two small children and was advised to write to learn direct to request cancellation and to request a refund........All of which I have done, They have have refused to cancel my course and are still taking payments from my bank account each month.......Ive been signed up fot two months and not been contacted once by learn direct regarding how I am getting on with the course which I havent even had a chance to look at yet...........I have now lost my job and have had to claim benefits for the time being and have informed Learn Direct of this yet still refused to cancel my course still continuing to take payment 150 a month absolutely disgusted in Learn direct will go to media with this and seeking legal advise

headline: I recently paid ¬£500 for a Teaching and‚Ä¶
reviewBody: I recently paid ¬£500 for a Teaching and Learning Assistant level 3 QCF course for my wife Maureen Jones. At no point were me or my wife ever informed by any means that schools would could and very firmly do ask for the person to have already achieved GCSE In both Maths and English. If I/we had known this we would have asked the local schools prior to signing up ¬£500 for the course beforehand. As a result of not being informed enrolling on this course getting to the point of requiring works experience inside a school my Wife Maureen has contacted every local school (6) and not one of them will allow her to get works experience from them without holding this qualification. Contacted Learn Direct David who tried to fob us of with some lame response but still the fact remains we have not been fully informed prior to taking the course fee. Sent a letter (stage3) complaints procedure to the STONEBRIDGE ASSOCIATED COLLEGES in Bude Cornwall who rather pathetically said sorry to hear to are cancelling your study!!! I am requesting for a full refund due to not being informed and the miss-selling/misleading of your product. I have now Contacted the Financial Services Authority who regulate these fraudsters and the next step will be local MP county Court etc etc SHAME ON LEARN Direct for not doing the right thing and giving back my money.

headline: Cancelled course still being charged?
reviewBody: Signed up my partner for a course last year however didn't complete any of the course. After calling the office to cancel I was told that I had to write a letter to the head office. The customer service agent literally told me 'they handle cancellations on an individual basis and depends what mood they are in as to whether they will accept', this after another customer service agent had told me I could do this over the phone (which you can't). This instantly made me question the integrity of the company (having read previous responses on Trust Pilot from Learn Direct, I see you have access to past phone conversation transcripts so would be very happy for you to examine this). I sent off a letter to the head office (which again seems an archaic way of doing business for an online company?) and never received a response back. I haven't been charged anything over the past 10 months so assumed all had been cancelled. That is until suddenly, ¬£120 was debited from my account last month again!? This course hasn't been accessed in almost a year and as far as I know has been cancelled??? It has been a very poor experience working with Learn Direct and I can only hope this is resolved soon as I cannot afford such expense for a service I have never received!

headline: problems logging in to the system
reviewBody: The reason I‚Äôm giving a 3* rating is because I‚Äôm still new to this therefore I haven‚Äôt experienced much yet in regards to having my work marked or having to get in touch with my tutor for guidance/help. So far so good apart from the fact that I always have problems logging in to the system. It happens all the time and wastes valuable studying time. Being a mother of 3, I have no time to waste as I plan my studying hours around my children. I have been in touch with advisors over the phone. A few times I have been transferred only to end up reaching an answerphone which is pointless. I‚Äôve also left messages with my details but no one seemed to call back. Last week I spoke to a gentleman on the phone (didn‚Äôt catch his name) he was very helpful and assured me that I wouldn‚Äôt have any problems logging in to the system. I managed to access my work/course on that particular day but the following day the same problem occurred.

headline: Miss-selling of a product and then no‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
Miss-selling of a product and then no contact with regards refunding me my money.
I paid for a level 3 teaching and learning course for my wife at the cost of approximately ¬£500 and was never informed in any way that schools when having to do the 50 hours works experience would all demand that the person has GCSE Maths/English and so my Wife is unable to continue with her course.
And no one from Head office has called my Wife to discuss her grievances, not very customer focused at all only when selling a product and not when something goes wrong. I will be contacting my local MP / Trading standards and other parties if this is not resolved satisfactorily.
Learn Direct is very poor with regards to this matter. never again will my wife or I or anyone we know be undertaking any future coursed with this provider.

headline: managing teams course
reviewBody: I purchased the Managing Teams course for ¬£41.74 and I am incredibly disappointed. It was an absolute waste of money and I completed it within 32 minutes! Baring in mind that I had 45% discount I am still in shock with how short and uninformative it is! I could literally learn what I did in that half an hour by reading the description of the course. After completing I thought it was just the introduction I had completed, I can not believe that this course would have been ¬£75.89 full price?! This course has not widened my knowledge and I am very annoyed that I have just spent ¬£40 on half an hours course. How can you justify that? I did contact customer service requesting a refund. They responded with the offer of another course, and to be honest if it‚Äôs anything like the one I took it is a waste of time.

headline: It says for me to be honest.....
reviewBody:
It says for me to be honest.....

Learndirect course that I paid for was initially online, the moment I purchased it I could access all online areas to where I can learn.

24hrs later all online learning was removed. "David" said it's a paper learning course.

From a dyslexic point of view and my wife has irlens, reading black on white is extremely difficult.

***Thank you for making my wife and I feel extremely inadequate because of our learning difficulties***

It was not in the fine print, we are have issues with reading the book provided and to add salt into the wound.

My wife bought the same course and they only supplied one book.

I mean c'mon people... It comes across that your running a Mickey mouse operation here.

headline: Absolutely dreadful organisation
reviewBody: Absolutely dreadful organisation.  Take money from your bank account even when you have not signed an agreement and raised issues in relation to their sales.  Their sales approach is completely disgraceful.  It is not transparent and what they promise on the phone is. It backed up in the written contract - you are apparently meant to wait on trust for a refund at the end of the course.  Completely unethical - I am having to report them to my bank for wrongly taking funds from my account. My advice would be to stay well away from this company but if you do go ahead read the contract carefully before you give them any bank details as otherwise they just take money you have not agreed to.

headline: Always difficult to submit my units.
reviewBody: Always difficult to submit my units.

headline: A course full of errors......
reviewBody:
I recently started a level 2 maths course and the course is full of countless errors I would often write an answer to be told it was wrong yet the answer they gave was identical to mine. Also some of the answers they gave did not correspond with the question, and some pages would not open so you ended up missing some of the course.
At the end of each segment you were quizzed and given a percentage 80% to pass ect on some occasions it said failed but due to the countless errors I wasn`t sure if I had failed or was it another error so I started doubting mysef. I spoke to a tutor and was sold they are aware of errors but could not help me as I`d already started. I`ve requested a refund.

headline: Very happy with my course!
reviewBody: It was very easy to sign up and pay and the person setting up my course was very helpful. The course itself is very easy to understand. I did have a slight technical issue when signing up where the confirmation box could not be seen on the screen. I tried it in two different browsers but still nothing. In the end I pressed tab and enter and hoped for the best and it worked fine. Also I was told that there were no essays and that it was all multiple choice questions which was completely untrue, not that I mind but it was just a little misleading. Other than those small points I am very happy with it!

headline: DO NOT PURCHASE FROM THEM, FALSE ADVERTISING
reviewBody:
This business will mis-sell you products and when you try too dispute will ignore you, yet happily take customer and clients money.
The certificates are not provided by proper regular awarded bodies so please do your research before signing up. As this is a business who does not like to take accountability for their wrong doing but will still bully you into taking your money, and quite aggressively may I add.
You can find cheaper online learning service at a much better rate which will take you further in your fields.

headline: I gave 3 * because I've tryed to talk‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
I gave 3 * because I've tryed to talk with someone  via email and online chat and no one answered me. I wonder why Learndirect have an email and chat service if they dont use them? 
Finaly, I decided to call them. The seller was very polite and he answered all my questions. Probabily, if I started with a phone call and not with an email my experience would be different.
I bought a course, but I didn't start it yet, so therefore, I can not evaluate the quality of lessons or the feedback from my tutor.

headline: No refund after 2 1/2 months
reviewBody: I signed up for a course in August and due to family circumstances I had to cancel! I cancelled within the 14 day money back guarantee and I am still waiting for a refund after so many calls and emails! Some to management with replies saying they will look it to it and are waiting for payment to be signed off!!! It‚Äôs now nearly 2 1/2 months later and I‚Äôm still chasing my refund! I have now been charged interest on the credit card I used! Really poor service would not recommend

headline: Worse company I have ever dealt with.
reviewBody:
This is the worse experience I have had with a company.
I have emailed numerous occasions regards issues and nothing is still been addressed.
A deadline has been given for a course but yet no products (kit) that you get has been provided.
A study break was processed and they are not willing to honour this.
How they can insist a course getting completed without providing the kit I will never know.
The most unprofessional and unethical  people I have dealt with. 
I complained via email and even that wasn‚Äôt handled as a complaint should be handled.
I am now in the process of taking legal action due to them breaching contract.
All the students I have spoken to have had a similar experience.

headline: False advertising and sales information
reviewBody:
Signed up following advice that there was an exam centre in my county.  Found this was not correct (despite them still advertising the centre as available).  Requested a refund which was rejected.  Blatant lies from sales advisors.  Be very aware of what you are agreeing to and check your exam centre before paying.

** Edit. Regarding response from Learn Direct, have already dealt with customer servs and complaints dept who have already declined to comment on my complaint or discuss a refund.

headline: I have been looking at courses on learn‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
I have been looking at courses on learn direct for a while now, slightly uncertain about studying online and wanted to make sure the course I was committing to was accredited. Simon talked through the process, answered any questions I asked and gave me reassurance.

Committing to the course online meant I can balance family and work life and also the cost of doing the course online saved me a considerable amount of money with payment options to suit.

The enrolment process was easy and I look forward to starting my course.

headline: Signing up was easy.
reviewBody:
Signing up was easy.

However, I'm missing a star because the course content isn't particularly well written or laid out and the word search and hangman games designed to be aide memoires or to break up the learning are pointless at best. 

Also, I went on holiday to come back and find I was over a week late on an assignment. No email, phone call, text or nothing. I went with Skills Network for my Level 2 and they phoned up if I was a day late on an assignment to see if I was ok. Looks like Learn Direct might not be so bothered.

reviewBody:
I have recently enrolled in a course with Learndirect. I was unsure of my start up procedure, due to my circumstances, the course I selected wasn't suitable for me. Louis

headline: Extremely unsympathetic and unreliable
reviewBody:
Extremely unsympathetic and unreliable to say the least.
I enrolled with learn direct unfortunately before I logged in or use their materials my situation changed I emailed David  if I can postpone cos I‚Äôm having financial crisis and dealing with personal stuff. He replied cos the 14 weeks is over I can‚Äôt cancel. 
On their website it says  ‚ÄúOutside the standard Terms and Conditions cancellations may be considered on a case by case situation. In this case a cancellation fee equating to 50% of the remaining course balance will be charged. This fee will be requested as a one-off payment to settle the account.‚Äù  
I emailed him again then he said ‚Äú In this case and as a one off gesture of good will, I‚Äôd be willing to offer what is stated within the Terms and Conditions and release you from the contract however as clearly stated, this would be at a 50% charge of what is remaining‚Äú
Then to that I replied can I pay you using my credit card ? Then he changed his mind he emailed me his manager said  if you are willing to pay you can pay us monthly using your credit card. I asked why the manager denied my request and David emailed me the manager didn‚Äôt give any reason. I have all the email conversations.
I haven‚Äôt used any material, I haven‚Äôt started the course and I‚Äôm straggling financially and dealing with personal issue. They forcing me keep paying them every month using my credit card , instead of making me pay for the remaining half of the course as his first email  indicated.

reviewBody:

This is a highly dodgy company.  Be wary

headline: Buyer Beware
reviewBody: I signed up with learn direct and was under the impression that my exam was included in the price. I didn't get on with their course material, however I just carried on to book the exam to be told I have to book and pay extra for my exam. This was not made clear when I booked. I made a complaint to learn direct who basically said that I was wrong. They are not clear when selling courses that the exam is extra but has a bit on their website that I didn't use until after I had signed up. Buyer beware!!

headline: OFSTED RATES INADEQUATE
reviewBody:
Please be aware that the request to leave a review immediately after making a purchase is sent by LearnDirect advisors, leading me to believe most are written with little knowledge or actual experience with them. I had been battling with LearnDirect since June 2019 and is now Nov 2019, they have no real complaints procedure with waiting up to 6 weeks at a time for a reply and forced over to what seems their sister company Stonebridge to deal with the matter, to only be directed back. Finally, received a response to my formal complaint that was just another empty apology and not resolving the problem or providing answers to the unnecessary consequences of their very poor actions. I then attempted to take this further with the Financial Ombudsman Service but seeing as I was no longer in contract with LearnDirect, it was not possible. However, newly named CDRL (Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) Services) would be the next step to take, the only downside to this is that the company being LearnDirect in this case, have to engage with the scheme and become a member in order to allow customers unhappy with their initial response to a complaint to take it further. As you could imagine, LearnDirect is not and refuse to fight them any longer if asking them to do so. So please be wary that in the event something does go wrong, your only outcome may be to face whatever decision LearnDirect mustards up after a lengthy period and move on. Have since joined Open Study College whom are fantastic, polite and don't force a narrative of themselves just because they may offered a good deal from the beginning, allowing you to really get a grip of their service to then form your own opinion. Here is a list provided by the National Careers Service a month or two ago for distance learning, even free courses and more, not so surprisingly doesn't include LearnDirect;

odlqc (accredited providers)
learnbaes
open.edu openlearn 
oxbridgehomelearning
abcc homestudy
openstudycollege

He explained the qualification RQF is updated version of what other college offers & he gave me a terrific discount so I will enrol happily now :-) Very patient and friendly and easy to talk to!! Well done guys üôåüèΩ

headline: I wouldn't recommend an access course
reviewBody:
I am in the midst of trying the complete an access course with Learn Direct. 

I wouldn't recommend signing up with Learn Direct if you have any time limitations or need support.

It is not unusual to wait 10 days for an email response, even though they aim to respond within 48 - 72 hours. Then after writing a 2000 word report receiving 4 sentences of feedback. 

2 of which were -

"Section 2- looks ok"
"Section 4 - looks fine"

I was excited about studying the course, to begin with, now it's just frustrating. I don't feel I'm going to do as well as I could, because of a lack of support and guidance. 

Although some tutors are great, others make it impossible so I would recommend looking elsewhere.

I intended to register with this company to do a course and i got on the phone with the worst customer service ever.
This guy does not know how to answer questions and even picked up a fight with me on the phone. For what i noticed he was not in the mood to even talk on the phone as if i was disturbing him with my enquiry. Before i know it he just have to cut me off when i tried to get imformtion before i register. The worst experience in my entire time.
