headline: Easy to set up, good support, and deals on finance.
reviewBody: Easy to set up, and all work is online. Staff are friendly and helpful and access is provided to a tutor if needed. Lots of tips on study skills, and how to answer questions. Can be paid in installments which is great, and there are some really great deals. I got 40% off which is a bargain.

headline: So far so good
reviewBody:
So far so good! I recently enrolled on Cognitive behavioural therapy level 5 and am thoroughly enjoying the experience! I have a hectic life working full time and with 3 children but the course is fitting perfectly around my other responsibilities as I can just grab as much or as little time as I can when I can. Perks of distance learning!
The cost was a lot less than I anticipated plus I'll get ¬£100 cashback upon completion.
The man that I spoke with was super friendly and helpful and I managed to get 35% off (which goes a long way when you have a family).
I feel like I am finally getting somewhere with my career as I will qualify as a counsellor (hopefully)

headline: I enrolled on the Aromatherapy Diploma‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
I enrolled on the Aromatherapy Diploma course in March this year. A lovely lady called Tamsyn enrolled me and answered any queries I had and helped me find the right course for me. She was friendly and patient and gave me a great discount, which was fantastic because I am on long term sick and so just couldn't afford it to be too expensive. She also set me up with the right payment method for me so I could pay my course fee monthly, which was also really helpful to me.


Tamsyn also was very supportive and said I could contact her and gave me her contact number and email if I needed any help and support. I have also been able to speak to her when I've been struggling or needed to ask her anything about my course. Overall, I am really enjoying it and I would highly recommend LearnDirect to anyone. And especially Tamsyn who has been fantastic and provided me with really excellent support and been very informative too. 


So a BIG THANK YOU Tamsyn :)

headline: worse experience I had ever had in my life
reviewBody:
I bought a online course from Learndirect Limited because I was not able to attend classes. It took a month to find my tutor. Once I finished the course, I had to find to sit in a exam which I didn't know. I asked for a help out for the exam centres but I got a web browser to find out myself. They are selling their online courses giving a lot of discount like selling books in book shop but you wont get certificate from them. I wasted my ¬£200 buying that course instead I would buy a book from whsmith in ¬£7 which is better than course. 

If there was a option i would give them 0 star

I would definitely recomend this course to busy mums who don‚Äôt have the flexibility to get to colleges whilst juggling a busy home life.  I can do the course in my own time and it‚Äôs not against a deadline.  I submit the work when I can.

headline: Fantastic company
reviewBody:

I did a Dental Nursing course in 2016 and it was fantastic, I received so much support from my tutor who gave me so much knowledge and confidence in my job.

I am currently doing an Access to HE in Biological Science which is equally as good, the criteria and study information is very clear in order for you to complete units  to your desired grade.

I would recommend this course to anyone, especially those who are looking for a course that‚Äôs easily accessible and convenient.

headline: Excellent experience of Learn Direct‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Excellent experience of Learn Direct all round. From the signing up to the actual course materials themselves,  l found the whole experience seamless. The course was very informative. I found it great. It was well-designed and easy to use. Excellent value also. I look fwd to do many more courses in the future, in particular, languages. Thank you.

headline: Choose Learn Direct :)
reviewBody: The whole process from speaking to advisers selling courses to tutors marking the work Learn Direct have impressed me. I had a number of options when considering my HLTA course but the the help and guidance of the course advisers i chose to go with learn direct which wasn't the cheapest but i felt like they was more interested in me rather than just the money. and  Learn Direct have been very supportive seen embarking on my course,  however i must admit assignment feedback sometimes takes a while to come back to. Also to mention, on the Learn Direct website it advertises the NUS extra Card but when i tried to sign up an adviser from the NUS said they wasn't a registered school/organisation. (I've not chased it up since) I would highly recommend learn Direct as they offer amazing discounts as well as a great online portal with plenty of learning materials,links and tutor support :)

reviewBody: I was looking for a course that sparked my interest, dream analysis. After looking around online I couldn't find any that were any good... until I visited learn direct! Not only do they have a variety of courses available, they have payment options which suited me perfectly! I enrolled on the course, which took minutes! The quality of the content is remarkable, enlightening and easy to follow. I am very pleased with my learn direct experience, I'm enjoying my course and I highly recommend them if you are considering enrolling!

headline: Nail Tech Course
reviewBody:
Enjoying course. Initially had difficulty as my course disappeared from the home screen and student support didn't get back when completed online forms and requested call backs. I then gave up on student support and contacted the person I enrolled with who then got it immediately sorted. 
Assignments are marked quickly and encouraging. 
Kit has not yet turned up and still waiting for tutor to reply to email but managed to speak to another person who was on it straight away and got a third person to contact me. Once made contact with a human, things do seem to get sorted. 
If all goes as planned, this way of learning works for me due to cost and I have two small children I have to work around. 
Keeping numbers of contacts, so if I need more support/help, I'll bypass student support and go straight to the helpful people.
Update of finishing course - not what it read, so no practical assessed, which seems crazy. Kept getting contradictions about practical assessments. Still lack of support/response from student support. Unsure if I would recommend.

headline: Do not reccommend.
reviewBody: In my opinion, the interface provided for course work and practice was hard to use and wasn't very clear. Any progress I made wouldn't be updated on the progress monitor, and I found it awkward to work through each section in a methodical and progressive manner, which is what is necessary when working towards a qualification of any kind. Customer support was terrible - or you could even say, non-existent. I tried several times to speak to student support, but every time I tried the phone would ring and ring and nobody would be there to pick up. I eventually wrote to them to request for a refund. Overall, I would never recommend them to anyone.

headline: If I could give 0 stars I would!
reviewBody:
I completed a 12month course last June and I still haven't received the certificate. I chase them constantly and they are full of excuses and don't even bother to check if their new excuse completely contradicts the previous ones. 

Avoid like the plague! When so many well established colleges and universities are doing the same courses there is no need to put yourself through this. 

They could be handling my situation so much more professionally, they don't update me at all, they just wait for me to chase and then they spoon feed me false hope that the certificate will be with me 'soon'.

headline: Customer support is appalling
reviewBody: Customer support is appalling. Find another provider. Parts of the course don't work and no matter how many times you ask no-one comes back to you. Wish I had not used them. Cant advise strongly enough.......go elsewhere and save yourself some stress!

headline: Customer service is beyond poor
reviewBody: Customer service is beyond poor. They are more sales focused than actually making sure you are on the right course. The website is also very unreliable. Not worth the money, would look elsewhere.

headline: The customer service is poor and huge lack of communication
reviewBody: The customer service is poor, mostly due to the lack of communication between departments and their being taken over by Stonebridge UK. Response time is not great and they don‚Äôt seem like a legitimate company. I signed up with them for a HE access diploma and due to time restraints, I had no choice to take the course up with them. But BEWARE....

headline: Current Student
reviewBody:
I am currently two-thirds of the way through the Social Sciences and Humanities course.

Pros:
Very good tutors who provide useful advice and are supportive of your efforts;
Initial course units help to engage the learner into the process of studying, learning and going to university;
Interesting and diverse topics of study.
Most students study for 10 hours per week on average, leaving plenty of time for work and other activities.

Cons:
Late feedback/marking on occasion;
Some study materials lack detail and, on rare occasions, some material was copy-and-pasted straight from other websites (without references).
Some unit assignments required surveys to be conducted or presentations to be made (by video), which this student found difficult.

Conclusion:
I would definitely recommend Learndirect as a means of progressing to university or for general study/learning/career advancement purposes. Despite late feedback at times and occasionally weak study materials, the course I am studying has proven to be interesting, useful and easy to get involved with.

headline: Excellent staff and Course (Social Science)
reviewBody:
I have been studying a HE Social Science distance learning course since June 2018. A distance learning course means I can study from home around my busy schedule. 

The staff have all been very supportive and friendly from the start.
Don't be put off by the first few units of the course i.e learning to write a personal statement or regarding the course handbook. I found this all very useful and understood why this was included in the work. 

As you progress in the course you will learn how to write academically so the first few units are useful to practice with. 

Drafts can be sent to tutors before you submit your final assignment. This is very helpful as the tutors do give feedback on any information you may have missed or could change. 

I feel the course material is well laid out and informative. There is a section for addition study material, which is also very helpful. 

It is not necessary to buy books or other study material as it is all online and readily available. But with any course you study it is in your best interest to build your knowledge further by researching. The purpose of studying is so you learn in a way that you remember. I write lots of notes and use flash cards for important points. I also set a time table, use assignment planners and mind maps.

There are a number of online second hand book stores you can buy good quality books from for a decent price or you could ask your local library to order books in for you. You can also search on various websites for the information you need, which costs you nothing. 

If you are motivated in completing a course you have to put in the effort to understanding the topic fully. The tutors are there to help you throughout the course. If you are struggling then ask for their help. 
Should I ever struggle with any of part of my course I am very sure the tutors and the rest of the team would be there for me. 

My experience so far has been excellent and I cannot recommend 'learn direct' enough.

headline: Very pleasant and clearly spoken
reviewBody: Very pleasant and clearly spoken.  Easy to understand.  Excellent and professional.

headline: Amazing experience
reviewBody: Amazing experience. Always getting the support from my assessor. Hardly recommending for everyone who is interested in healthcare:)

headline: Enquiried on a hospitality course and a‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Enquiried on a hospitality course and a adviser ring me to discuss options.  He choose a course that meet my budget and took details and discount. He promised to send log in details over straight away so I could get start. On the evening no log in details and when I check online account learn direct had passed payment details to another company.  Dispite 2 emails I not heard back from them and put matter in hands of police and card company. My advise avoid them

headline: Exceptionally rude and hostile staff
reviewBody: Yesterday I sat my Life in The UK Test at the Learndirect Centre in Croydon...The worst possible experience ever. The staff is intimidating and exceptionally rude, they treat people like a lower form of life. I was subject to an extended personal search, I had to show them my pockets and ears several times (for bluetooth devices), and I was asked to roll up my sleeves. I also had to show them that I switched off my mobile because one of the members of staff seemed not to believe me. I wasn't even allowed to finish my cup of water, although my exam was to be sat in 30 minutes. They didn't bother explain anything, they didn't talk to me, let alone a smile. They were asking questions in a cold manner and bullied me around the waiting area. All my moves were constantly watched like if I was a criminal.The atmosphere was very tense and intimidating, more like an interrogation room than the place where you sit an exam. The most arrogant, condescending and vile people I have come across within the educational sector...I strongly advise to avoid this place at all costs. I have already made an official complaint to the Home Office and I'm prepared to take a further action if I am not assured that this place will be scrutinised.

headline: Learndirect are only interested in‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
Learndirect are only interested in taking your money!  I did a CEH course back in 2014 and loads of promises where made, including how many times I could retake the test if I did fail.
I did fail near to the end of the 1 year long access to the course when taking the exam for the first time. The course was teaching Version 8 and when it came to the exam, most of the questions where for Version 9 - a very different exam which I was not trained or educated for!  
They did give me 1 retest but I had to beg for it. 
There was not much support along the way, and no follow up to see how you where doing, I had to ring them and some of the staff did try to be helpful but seemed lost in themselves.
This particular course is a difficult one and 1 year to complete it is far too little time. They should give you 2 years as you are only accessing their videos online anyway and other content. 
Like I said, only interested in your money, not getting you trained!

headline: Doing an apprenticeship for clinical‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
Doing an apprenticeship for clinical support worker for nhs the apprenticeship lasts 13 months work at local hospital for 37.5 hours a week. 6 months in no assessor for first 2 months then when we did get an assessor she was a new employee so didn't have a clue what she was doing and quit after a month another month before we got a new assessor who threw loads of course work at us to be completed in unrealistic time frame as well as doing a very hard job full time this was impossible.she lasted 2 months and quit no assessor at the moment. No one replies to emails or phone calls I have had to approach other assessors who come to visit other apprentices on ward to ask for their guidance. Even complaints don't get answered.
NHS please find another provider for this course I am so stressed and considering looking for another job.

headline: Complete waste of time
reviewBody: I wish I thought about checking reviews online before I wasted a couple of days learning nothing from an incredibly unqulaified tutor about marketing. He was a nice enough young guy, but he was incredibly ignorant about most basic things. It really was funny. I didn't pay for the course, but I am sure they got paid a ton of money by the government for wasting my time. Other people in the course were random people who didn't really need the course, and they knew nothing about the subject. Therefore, I am sure they believed all the erroneous information provided by the tutor, who really made major major mistakes. I didn't want to create trouble so I said nothing, but it was disgusting. I would not recommend any courses by these people to anyone. They even contacted me trying to convince me to take an equal opportunity and sexism related course, and when I mentioned I was a freelance worker thus had no employees, they still said I should still know these things... I laughed. But this is a horrible scam and ultimately, we do pay for all these shenanigans through our taxes. It's maddening.

headline: The customer service is shocking!
reviewBody: The customer service is shocking!

headline: Studying Early years educator level 3
reviewBody:
Studying Early years educator level 3. Really poor support, when I email my tutor for advice have to wait at least 5 working days for a response. 
Tutor was supposed to of come out to see me on unit 4 to do an assessment but been told this is not happening now until at least unit 9.
I feel really let down by them and considering leaving.

headline: I purchased a short course
reviewBody: I purchased a short course. It was apparent immedietly it was unsuitable. Requested refund. 5 days later reply refusing refund. 2 phone calls later having had to quote my consumer rights I had an email stating I would get a refund. 1 month later NO REFUND has been issued. Poor and slow customer service.

headline: Poor Quality Service
reviewBody: I got a course in customer services in Hounslow-Ashley house. The course quality is inadequate, and the teacher‚Äôs accent is not a pure English and she confessed not qualified. She is also rude and unhelpful when a student needs an explanation.  The teaching strategies are backward and mind-narrowing. The course does not worth attending. Also there is no class for the students - just a section outlined with barriers. Not recommended at all.

headline: Worked for BSS in Leicester on learndirect
reviewBody: Worked for BSS in Leicester doing customer service for learn diret for 7 years,  in leicester they are racist, only reward white staff my performance rating was never went below 97% applied for promotion 5 times but always was overlooked and at one point job given to a new starter who had only joined 2 weeks earlier. Never work for BSS or learn direct.  The online courses had many problems  how is a learner who is trying to learn how to use a computer supposed to install software like java on a pc. Badly  thought out, no wonder ofsted report slated learndirect and they wanted it covered up. Best idea is for the government to give this project to another provider/company to run.

headline: HORRENDOUS WEBSITE
reviewBody: The staff have been wonderful but the website is horrific to navigate it's poorly designed, there's spelling mistakes and sections do not fit on the screen Its horrendous and half the time its impossible to get onto your learning due to server errors, I have nothing positive to say about it at all.

headline: Absolute garbage
reviewBody: Absolute garbage. They just want to enroll on free course. That they get paid for of the government for doing so. The it department sucks and the software they have freezes kicks you out & is full of glitches. The tutor i was provided (chocolate fire guard ) comes to mind. He checked it out by logging on to my course and had the same issues. Said he would contact iT & get back too me 2 weeks ago ??? Nothing. Yet i get NoReply emails / telling me ive not logged on for 10days. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE.

headline: I contacted Learn Direct who informed ‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
I contacted Learn Direct who informed me they offered a GCSE maths equivalent course. I attended & registered for this course during May 2017. I was told to complete an initial maths level 2 assessment & achieved a good 92% pass mark (took 3 hours to complete). I was then asked to return next week in order to complete a maths level 3 assessment (this also took nearly 3 hours to complete). Upon this second visit, I was then told by the tutor that Learn Direct unfortunately could not offer me a GCSE maths equivalent course due to the fact that I scored 92% in my level 2 assessment last week & that if I had achieved a lower score of around 40% then I would have been offered a gcse maths equivalent course. This didn't make sense at all! Naturally, I was very upset & quite angry of the fact I was not told of this after my level 2 assessment I completed last week & i was also informed over the phone during my very 1st enquiry that they 'did' offer a GCSE maths equivalent course! I had made 2 visits to the Learn Direct centre in Birmingham city centre & have wasted nearly 6 hours of my time! (I found out afterwards that I may have been enrolled onto both maths assessments so that Learn Direct could receive government funding.......nice move if it is true!. 
Due to my negative experience & lack of being transparent with me, my sincere advice I'm afraid is to stay clear of this large organisation, thus avoid wasting your precious time!!

headline: What a crap company...tutors are crap ‚Ä¶
reviewBody: What a crap company...tutors are crap and their managers are worse.  if they don't like you then forget it !!!!  I will say customer service were helpful but the area manager and my tutor don't care.. its just ticking the boxes with them.....Thank Learndirect as you have successful put me off my job which I used to love .......

headline: Disgusting
reviewBody:
Awful experience with this so called learn direct.
No common sense,people that work there think they are above everyone else. 
Total waste of space and time. 
You put a complaint forward, the reply you get is even worse than what you went through.

headline: They are not to be trusted on contracts
reviewBody:
Started a contract with them to help on a project that was late for DVSA.
I after four days (without a computer) The project was cancelled.
They then refused to pay the standard two weeks notice. Offering two days.

Laughable incompetence at development. Underhand in dealing with contracts.

headline: LearnDirect SUCK! (if I could rate NO stars I would)
reviewBody:
I have been sent to LearnDirect by the job center who were told to put me on a work placement. I was offered 2 placements, both were rubbish. 

One was miles away and though still within my distance limit to get to it started before I could have got there so I'd have been late every morning. 

The second I was told was new and had only been going for a few months and they just sat around doing nothing, so I have no idea what the point of that was was. It was shortly closed by health and safety as it was unsafe any way so I ended up finding my own placement
.
Since working on the placement I have got on very well with the supervisor and am also getting on well with the boss who owns a number of companies, and have been told I have a very good chance at a job at the end of my placement, if I want one with them. 

Now here is the part where LearnDirect confuse me...
They called me to say that jobs are available but only last for 8 weeks and are twisting my arm to take up one. Now they know it's a safe bet that I'll have one with my placement but dont seem to care and just want me to take one that lasts 8 weeks.

If I leave my placement to go and work for someone else for 8 weeks then my chance of working with them is ZERO and I'll be unemployed again just before Christmas. 

I have explained this to them and they dont give a toss.

This is the third time I have had contact with LearnDirect and all 3 times they have offered VERY POOR service. Hope this will be the last time I have to enter a LearnDirect building.
